item.name: Acid Flask
entries: This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, the listed {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent acid damage}, and the listed {@spell acid splash|CRB} damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls.
It deals {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent acid damage} and 1 {@spell acid splash|CRB} damage.
You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 2d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent acid damage} and 2 {@spell acid splash|CRB} damage.
You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 3d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent acid damage} and 3 {@spell acid splash|CRB} damage.
You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 4d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent acid damage} and 4 {@spell acid splash|CRB} damage.

item.name: Alchemist’s Fire
entries: {@class Alchemist|CRB}’s fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. {@class Alchemist|CRB}’s fire deals the listed fire damage, {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage}, and splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls.
The bomb deals {@dice 1d8} fire damage, 1 {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage}, and 1 fire splash damage.
You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 2d8} fire damage, 2 {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage}, and 2 fire splash damage.
You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 3d8} fire damage, 3 {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage}, and 3 fire splash damage.
You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 4d8} fire damage, 4 {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage}, and 4 fire splash damage.

item.name: Bottled Lightning
entries: Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals the listed electricity damage and electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes {@condition flat-footed} until the start of your next turn. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls.
It deals {@dice 1d6} electricity damage and 1 electricity splash damage.
You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 2d6} electricity damage and 2 electricity splash damage.
You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 3d6} electricity damage and 3 electricity splash damage.
You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 4d6} electricity damage and 4 electricity splash damage.

item.name: Frost Vial
entries: The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls.
The bomb deals {@dice 1d6} cold damage and 1 cold splash damage, and the target takes a –5-foot penalty.
You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals {@dice 2d6} cold damage and 2 cold splash damage, and the target takes a –10-foot penalty.
You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals {@dice 3d6} cold damage and 3 cold splash damage, and the target takes a –10-foot penalty.
You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals {@dice 4d6} cold damage and 4 cold splash damage, and the target takes a –15-foot penalty.

item.name: Tanglefoot Bag
entries: A {@spell tanglefoot|CRB} bag is filled with sticky substances.
When you hit a creature with a {@spell tanglefoot|CRB} bag, that creature takes a status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute.
Many types of {@spell tanglefoot|CRB} bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls.

On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and {@condition immobilized} for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to {@action Fly|CRB} again for 1 round. {@spell Tanglefoot|CRB} bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 {@action Interact|CRB} actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These {@action Interact|CRB} actions don’t have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.
The target takes a –10-foot penalty, and the {@action Escape|CRB} DC is 17.
You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –15-foot penalty, and the {@action Escape|CRB} DC is 19.
You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –15-foot penalty, and the {@action Escape|CRB} DC is 28.
You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –20-foot penalty, and the {@action Escape|CRB} DC is 37.

item.name: Thunderstone
entries: When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.
The bomb deals {@dice 1d4} sonic damage and 1 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 17.
You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 2d4} sonic damage and 2 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 20.
You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 3d4} sonic damage and 3 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 28.
You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals {@dice 4d4} sonic damage and 4 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 36.

item.name: Antidote
entries: An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours.
You gain a +2 item bonus.
You gain a +3 item bonus.
You gain a +4 item bonus.

You gain a +4 item bonus, and when you drink the antidote, you can immediately attempt a saving throw against one poison of 14th level or lower affecting you. If you succeed, the poison is neutralized.

item.name: Antiplague
entries: Antiplague can fortify the body’s defenses against diseases.
Upon drinking an antiplague, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against diseases for 24 hours; this applies to your daily save against a disease’s progression.
You gain a +2 item bonus.
You gain a +3 item bonus.
You gain a +4 item bonus.

You gain a +4 item bonus, and when you drink the antiplague, you can immediately attempt a saving throw against one disease of 14th level or lower affecting you. If you succeed, you are cured of the disease.

item.name: Bestial Mutagen
entries: Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is {@condition clumsy}.
Benefit You gain an item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack with the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack.
Drawback You take a –1 penalty to AC and a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.
You gain a +1 item bonus, your claw deals {@dice 1d4} slashing damage, your jaws deal {@dice 1d6} piercing damage, and the duration is 1 minute.
You gain a +2 item bonus, your claw deals {@dice 1d6} slashing damage, your jaws deal {@dice 1d8} piercing damage, and the duration is 10 minutes.
You gain a +3 item bonus, your claw deals {@dice 1d8} slashing damage, your jaws deal {@dice 1d10} piercing damage, and the duration is 1 hour.

You gain a +4 item bonus, your claw deals {@dice 1d8} slashing damage, your jaws deal {@dice 1d10} piercing damage, and the duration is 1 hour. You gain weapon specialization with the claws and jaws, or greater weapon specialization, if you already have weapon specialization with these unarmed attacks.

item.name: Bomber’s Eye Elixir
entries: This tincture lets you pinpoint your foes. For the next 5 minutes, your alchemical bomb Strikes reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover.
Reduce your targets’ circumstance bonus by 1.
Reduce your targets’ circumstance bonus by 2.

item.name: Bravo’s Brew
entries: This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain an item bonus to Will saves, which is greater when attempting Will saves against {@spell fear|CRB}.
The bonus on Will saves is +1, or +2 against {@spell fear|CRB}.
The bonus on Will saves is +2, or +3 against {@spell fear|CRB}.
The bonus on Will saves is +3, or +4 against {@spell fear|CRB}. If you roll a success on a save against {@spell fear|CRB}, you get a critical success instead.

item.name: Cat’s Eye Elixir
entries: After you consume this elixir, your vision sharpens and you become sensitive to even the most minute movements. For the next minute, you reduce the flat check to target {@condition hidden} creatures to 5, and you don’t need to attempt a flat check to target {@condition concealed} creatures. These benefits apply only against creatures within 30 feet of you.

item.name: Cheetah’s Elixir
entries: Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a status bonus to your Speed for the listed duration.
The bonus is +5 feet, and the duration is 1 minute.
The bonus is +10 feet, and the duration is 10 minutes.
The bonus is +10 feet, and the duration is 1 hour.

item.name: Cognitive Mutagen
entries: Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral.

Benefit You gain an item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to {@action Recall Knowledge|CRB}. Your critical failures on {@action Recall Knowledge|CRB} checks become failures instead.

Drawback You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming {@condition encumbered}, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.
The bonus is +1, and the duration is 1 minute.
The bonus is +2, and the duration is 10 minutes.
The bonus is +3, and the duration is 1 hour. You become trained in one Intelligence-based skill, chosen at {@spell creation|CRB}.
The bonus is +4, and the duration is 1 hour. You become trained in one skill, chosen at {@spell creation|CRB}.

item.name: Comprehension Elixir
entries: This bitter draught opens your mind to the potential of the written word. For the listed duration after drinking this elixir, you can understand any words you read, so long as they are written in a common language. This elixir doesn’t automatically allow you to understand codes or extremely esoteric passages—you still need to attempt a skill check to {@action Decipher Writing|CRB}.
The duration is 1 minute.
The duration is 10 minutes.

item.name: Darkvision Elixir
entries: After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in {@spell darkness|CRB}. You gain {@spell darkvision|CRB} for the listed duration.
The duration is 10 minutes.
The duration is 1 hour.
The duration is 24 hours.

item.name: Eagle-eye Elixir
entries: After you drink this elixir, you notice subtle visual details. For the next hour, you gain an item bonus to Perception checks that is greater when attempting to find secret doors and traps.
The bonus is +1, or +2 to find secret doors and traps.
The bonus is +2, or +3 to find secret doors and traps.
The bonus is +3, or +4 to find secret doors and traps.
The bonus is +3, or +4 to find secret doors and traps. Each time you pass within 10 feet of a secret door or trap, the GM automatically rolls a secret check for you to find it.

item.name: Elixir Of Life
entries: Elixirs of life accelerate the body’s natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain the listed number of Hit Points and gain an item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.
The elixir restores {@dice 1d6} Hit Points, and the bonus is +1.
The elixir restores {@dice 3d6+6} Hit Points and the bonus is +1.
The elixir restores {@dice 5d6+12} Hit Points, and the bonus is +2.
The elixir restores {@dice 7d6+18} Hit Points, and the bonus is +2.
The elixir restores {@dice 8d6+21} Hit Points, and the bonus is +3.
The elixir restores {@dice 10d6+27} Hit Points, and the bonus is +4.

item.name: Elixir Of Rejuvenation
entries: The elixir of rejuvenation restores a creature to full health and eradicates toxins affecting it. When you drink this elixir, you’re restored to your maximum Hit Points, and all afflictions of 20th level or lower affecting you are removed.

You can instead administer this elixir to a creature that has been dead for a week or less. When you do, that creature is instantly brought back to life with 1 Hit Point and no spell slots, Focus Points, or other daily resources.
item.craft_requirements: philosopher’s stone, true elixir of life.

item.name: Infiltrator’s Elixir
entries: Favored by spies and tricksters, an infiltrator’s elixir is used to alter your appearance. When imbibed, you take the shape of a humanoid creature of your size, but different enough so you might be unrecognizable. If you aren’t a humanoid, you might take on a form more similar to your own, at the GM’s discretion.

The creator of the elixir decides the basics of the appearance you transform into when you imbibe the elixir, including eye color, skin tone, and hair color. The elixir can’t change your form into that of a specific person. After the form takes hold, you retain it for the next 10 minutes.

Drinking this elixir counts as setting up a disguise to Impersonate. You gain a +4 status bonus to your Deception DC to avoid others seeing through your disguise, and you add your level to this DC even if untrained.

item.name: Juggernaut Mutagen
entries: After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant.

Benefit You gain an item bonus to Fortitude saves and the listed number of temporary Hit Points. Whenever you are at maximum Hit Points for at least 1 full minute, you regain the temporary Hit Points.
Drawback You take a –2 penalty to Will saves, Perception checks, and initiative rolls.
The bonus is +1, you gain 5 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 1 minute.
The bonus is +2, you gain 10 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 10 minutes.
The bonus is +3, you gain 30 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 1 hour. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

The bonus is +4, you gain 45 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 1 hour. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead, and your critical failures on Fortitude saves become failures instead.

item.name: Leaper’s Elixir
entries: This tingly solution increases the elasticity and contraction of your leg muscles. For 1 minute after drinking this elixir, you can {@action High {@spell Jump|CRB}|CRB} or {@action Long {@spell Jump|CRB}|CRB} as a single action instead of 2 actions. If you do, you don’t perform the initial {@action Stride|CRB} (nor do you fail if you don’t {@action Stride|CRB} 10 feet).
The maximum vertical distance you can {@spell jump|CRB} with a {@action High {@spell Jump|CRB}|CRB} is the same as you can {@spell jump|CRB} horizontally with a {@action Long {@spell Jump|CRB}|CRB}.

item.name: Mistform Elixir
entries: A faint mist emanates from your skin, making you {@condition concealed} for the listed duration. As usual being {@condition concealed} when your position is still obvious, you can’t use this concealment to {@action Hide|CRB} or {@action Sneak|CRB}.
The duration is 3 rounds.
The duration is 1 minute.
The duration is 5 minutes.

item.name: Quicksilver Mutagen
entries: Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile.
Benefit You gain an item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and ranged attack rolls, and you gain the listed status bonus to your Speed.
Drawback You take damage equal to twice your level; you can’t recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a –2 penalty to Fortitude saves.
The bonus to rolls is +1, the bonus to Speed is +5 feet, and the duration is 1 minute.
The bonus to rolls is +2, the bonus to Speed is +10 feet, and the duration is 10 minutes.
The bonus to rolls is +3, the bonus to Speed is +15 feet, and the duration is 1 hour.
The bonus to rolls is +4, the bonus to Speed is +20 feet, and the duration is 1 hour.

item.name: Salamander Elixir
entries: This elixir is made from salamander scales to withstand fire. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe heat.
You’re also protected from extreme heat.
You’re also protected from extreme and incredible heat.

item.name: Sea Touch Elixir
entries: This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet.
The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for the listed duration.
The duration is 10 minutes.
The duration is 1 hour, and you can breathe underwater.
The duration is 24 hours, and you can breathe underwater.

item.name: Serene Mutagen
entries: You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting.
Benefit You gain an item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks.
This bonus improves when you attempt Will saves against mental effects.
Drawback You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.
The bonus is +1, or +2 vs. mental, and the duration is 1 minute.
The bonus is +2, or +3 vs. mental, and the duration is 10 minutes.
The bonus is +3, or +4 vs. mental, and the duration is 1 hour.
When you roll a success on a Will save against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead.

The bonus is +4, and the duration is 1 hour. When you roll a success on a Will save against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead, and your critical failures on Will saves against mental effects become failures instead.

item.name: Silvertongue Mutagen
entries: Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason.
Benefit You gain an item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead.

Drawback You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to {@action Recall Knowledge|CRB} become critical failures.
The bonus is +1, and the duration is 1 minute.
The bonus is +2, and the duration is 10 minutes.
The bonus is +3, and the duration is 1 hour.
The bonus is +4, and the duration is 1 hour.

item.name: Stone Fist Elixir
entries: Your fists become hard as stone. For 1 hour, your fists deal {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage and lose the nonlethal trait.

item.name: Winter Wolf Elixir
entries: This elixir warms your core and improves your circulation. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe cold.
You’re also protected from extreme cold.
You’re also protected from extreme and incredible cold.

item.name: Arsenic
entries: This toxin is a compound of arsenic and other substances. You can’t reduce your {@condition sickened} condition while affected.

item.name: Belladonna
entries: Sometimes called “deadly nightshade,” belladonna is a widely available toxin produced from a plant similar to a tomato.

item.name: Black Adder Venom
entries: Adder venom is a simple but effective way to enhance a weapon.

item.name: Black Lotus Extract
entries: Black lotus extract causes severe internal bleeding.

item.name: Blightburn Resin
entries: This tacky, hardened sap is harvested from trees infected by fungal blights and exposed to open flames.

item.name: Brimstone Fumes
entries: Fumes from the forges of Hell drain health and strength alike.

item.name: Cytillesh Oil
entries: This thick substance is distilled from the mind-robbing cytillesh fungus, though it lacks memory-altering capabilities.

item.name: Deathcap Powder
entries: The toxic deathcap mushroom can be dried, ground, and treated to form a flavorless powder with accelerated effects.

item.name: Dragon Bile
entries: A mix of digestive juices and green dragon poison glands nauseates the victim as its flesh is digested from within.

item.name: Giant Centipede Venom
entries: Giant centipede venom causes severe muscle stiffness.

item.name: Giant Scorpion Venom
entries: Scorpion venom is excruciating and its effects are somewhat debilitating.

item.name: Giant Wasp Venom
entries: Giant wasp venom interferes with a victim’s movement.

item.name: Graveroot
entries: The opaque white sap from the graveroot shrub clouds the mind.

item.name: Hemlock
entries: Concentrated hemlock is a particularly deadly toxin that halts muscle action—including that of the victim’s heart.

item.name: Hunting Spider Venom
entries: This venom erodes its target’s defenses, aiding the spider in securing prey.

item.name: King’s Sleep
entries: King’s {@spell sleep|CRB} is an insidious long-term poison that can seem like a disease or even death from natural causes on a venerable target. The {@condition drained} condition from king’s {@spell sleep|CRB} is cumulative with each failed save and can’t be removed while the poison lasts.
Saving Throw DC 41 Fortitude; Onset 1 day; Stage 1 {@condition drained} 1 (1 day); Stage 2 {@condition drained} 1 (1 day); Stage 3 {@condition drained} 2 (1 day)

item.name: Lethargy Poison
entries: Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls {@condition unconscious}. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

stages.entry: unconscious with no Perception check to wake up
unconscious with no Perception check to wake up .

item.name: Lich Dust
entries: Dust salvaged from the remains of a destroyed lich has paralytic properties that make it a valuable poison.

item.name: Malyass Root Paste
entries: Malyass root paste sees use to impede opponents in athletic competitions, in addition to espionage and tracking.

stages.entry: clumsy 1 and –10-foot status penalty to all Speeds
clumsy 2 and –20-foot status penalty to all Speeds ;

item.name: Mindfog Mist
entries: Mindfog mist can be used to undermine spellcasters, as its effect on a victim’s mental faculties are swift and powerful.

item.name: Nettleweed Residue
entries: Concentrated sap of stinging weeds makes an effective toxin.

item.name: Nightmare Vapor
entries: Purportedly sourced from any number of outlandish locales, {@spell nightmare|CRB} vapor is most often created by boiling the sweat collected from humanoids caught in the throes of terrible nightmares.

item.name: Purple Worm Venom
entries: Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.

item.name: Shadow Essence
entries: Distilled from the Plane of Shadow, this oily substance imposes tenebrous effects. The {@condition enfeebled} condition from shadow essence lasts for 24 hours.

stages.entry: 3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 1
3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 2

item.name: Slumber Wine
entries: Slumber wine sees its greatest use in games of intrigue, where an absence can be more devastating than injury.

Characters {@condition unconscious} from slumber wine can’t wake up by any means while the poison lasts, don’t need to eat or drink while {@condition unconscious} in this way, and appear to be recently dead unless an examiner succeeds at a DC 40 Medicine check.

item.name: Spider Root
entries: A paste made by mashing the fine, threadlike roots of a certain creeper vine, spider root renders a victim {@condition clumsy} and maladroit.

item.name: Tears Of Death
entries: Tears of death are among the most powerful of alchemical poisons, distilled from extracts of five other deadly poisons in just the right ratios.

item.name: Wolfsbane
entries: Wolfsbane appears in folklore for its link to werecreatures.
If you are afflicted with lycanthropy and survive stage 3 of wolfsbane, you’re immediately cured of the lycanthropy.

item.name: Wyvern Poison
entries: Properly harvested and preserved, the poison from a wyvern’s sting is effective and direct.

item.name: Philosopher’s Stone
entries: An {@class alchemist|CRB} with the {@action Craft|CRB} Philosopher’s Stone feat can create a philosopher’s stone once per month by spending 1 batch of infused reagents during their daily preparations using the advanced alchemy class feature. This is the only way to create a philosopher’s stone.

At a glance, a philosopher’s stone appears to be an ordinary, sooty piece of natural rock. Breaking the rock open with a {@action Force Open|CRB} action (DC 35) reveals a cavity at the stone’s heart. The cavity is lined with a rare type of quicksilver that can transmute base metals into {@spell precious metals|CRB} or create an elixir of rejuvenation (page 548)
To use the quicksilver, you must be legendary in Crafting and have the Alchemical Crafting feat. You can then use the stone’s quicksilver for one of two effects:

items: You can apply the stone’s quicksilver to an infused true elixir of life using an {@action Interact|CRB} action. This turns the elixir into an infused elixir of rejuvenation instantaneously. This doesn’t require any crafting time or additional materials.

You can spend up to a month of downtime applying the quicksilver either to iron to create silver or to lead to create gold. Treat this as a 20th-level task to Earn Income using Crafting, except that you create 500 gp worth of your chosen metal per day on a success or 750 gp worth per day on a critical success.

item.name: Silversheen
entries: You can slather this silvery paste onto one melee weapon, one thrown weapon, or 10 pieces of ammunition. Silversheen spoils quickly, so once you open a vial, you must use it all at once, rather than saving it. For the next hour, the weapon or ammunition counts as silver instead of its normal precious material (such as cold iron) for any physical damage it deals.

item.name: Smokestick
entries: With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are {@condition concealed}, and all other creatures are {@condition concealed} to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.
The radius of the burst is 5 feet.
The radius of the burst is 20 feet.

item.name: Snake Oil
entries: You can apply snake oil onto a wound or other outward symptom of an affliction or condition (such as sores from a disease or discoloration from a poison). For the next hour, the symptom disappears and the {@condition wounded} or afflicted creature doesn’t feel as if it still has the wound or affliction, though all effects remain. A creature can uncover the ruse by succeeding at a DC 17 Perception check, but only if it uses a {@action Seek|CRB} action to specifically examine the snake oil’s effects.

item.name: Sunrod
entries: This 1-foot-long, gold-tipped rod glows after it’s struck on a hard surface. For the next 6 hours, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet).

item.name: Tindertwig
entries: An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same {@action Interact|CRB} action.

item.name: Adamantine Armor
entries: Adamantine armor has a shiny, black appearance and is amazingly durable.

variants.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include adamantine worth at least 200 gp + 20 gp per Bulk.
The initial raw materials must include adamantine worth at least 16,000 gp + 1,600 gp per Bulk.

item.name: Cold Iron Armor
entries: Cold iron armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to cold iron (such as most demons and fey) that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in cold iron armor becomes {@condition sickened} 1. A creature with weakness to cold iron is {@condition sickened} 1 as long as it wears cold iron armor.

variants.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include cold iron worth at least 70 sp + 7 sp per Bulk.
The initial raw materials must include at least 150 gp of cold iron + 15 gp per Bulk.
The initial raw materials must include cold iron worth at least 10,000 gp + 1,000 gp per Bulk.

item.name: Darkwood Armor
entries: Darkwood armor is 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on armor that normally has light Bulk). It’s easier to wear than normal wood armor, reducing the Strength score necessary to ignore its check penalty by 2 and reducing its Speed penalty by 5 feet. (There are no types of wood armor in this book.)

variants.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include darkwood worth at least 200 gp + 20 gp per Bulk.
The initial raw materials must include darkwood worth at least 16,000 gp + 1,600 gp per Bulk.

item.name: Dragonhide Armor
entries: Dragonhide armor is immune to one damage type based on the type of dragon it is made from (as listed in the table on page 579). Wearing armor made from dragonhide also grants you a +1 circumstance bonus to your AC and saving throws against attacks and spells that deal the corresponding damage type.

variants.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include dragonhide worth at least 200 gp + 20 gp per Bulk.
The initial raw materials must include dragonhide worth at least 16,000 gp + 1,600 gp per Bulk.

item.name: Elven Chain
entries: Elven chain is a chain shirt made of mithral (page 579) that glitters in even the faintest light. It grants a +2 item bonus to AC and has no check penalty.

Created by elven artisans employing ancient crafting techniques, elven chain is exceptionally quiet. Unlike other chain shirts—even other mithral chain shirts—elven chain does not have the noisy trait. This suit of armor can be etched with runes like any other mithral chain shirt.

variants.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include mithral worth at least 3,125 sp.
The initial raw materials must include mithral worth at least 26,000 gp.

item.name: Mithral Armor
entries: Mithral armor is 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on armor that normally has light Bulk). It’s easier to wear than normal metal armor, reducing the Strength score necessary to ignore its check penalty by 2 and reducing its Speed penalty by 5 feet.

variants.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include mithral worth at least 200 gp + 20 gp per Bulk.
The initial raw materials must include mithral worth at least 16,000 gp + 1,600 gp per Bulk.

item.name: Orichalcum Armor
entries: Orichalcum armor can be etched with four magic property runes instead of three due to the magical empowerment of orichalcum. If you are wearing armor made of orichalcum, the armor grants you insights into the future, granting you a +1 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls.

variants.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include orichalcum worth at least 27,500 gp + 2,750 gp per Bulk.

item.name: Silver Armor
entries: Silver armor sickens certain creatures that touch it. A creature with weakness to silver that critically fails an unarmed attack against a creature in silver armor becomes {@condition sickened} 1. A creature with weakness to silver is {@condition sickened} 1 as long as it wears silver armor.

variants.craft_requirements: silver worth at least 70 sp + 7 sp per Bulk.
The initial raw materials must include silver worth at least 150 gp + 15 gp per Bulk.
The initial raw materials must include silver worth at least 10,000 gp + 1,000 gp per Bulk.

item.name: Magic Armor
entries: A suit of magic armor is simply a suit of armor or explorer’s clothing etched with fundamental runes. An armor potency rune increases the armor’s item bonus to AC, and a resilient rune adds an item bonus to saving throws.
The Prices here are for all types of armor.
You don’t need to adjust the Price from leather armor to full plate or the like. These armors are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as mithral.
This armor has a +1 armor potency rune (increase the item bonus to AC by 1).
This armor has a +1 armor potency rune (increase the item bonus to AC by 1) and a resilient rune (+1 item bonus to saves).
This armor has a +2 armor potency rune (increase the item bonus to AC by 2) and a resilient rune (+1 item bonus to saves).
This armor has a +2 armor potency rune (increase the item bonus to AC by 2) and a greater resilient rune (+2 item bonus to saves).
This armor has a +3 armor potency rune (increase the item bonus to AC by 3) and a greater resilient rune (+2 item bonus to saves).
This armor has a +3 armor potency rune (increase the item bonus to AC by 3) and a major resilient rune (+3 item bonus to saves).

item.name: Breastplate Of Command
entries: This +1 resilient breastplate is made from shining bronze overlaid with reinforcing golden panels in the shape of lion’s heads. Wearing this breastplate grants you a commanding aura. You gain a +2 item bonus to Diplomacy checks, but you take a –2 item penalty to Stealth checks to {@action Hide|CRB} and {@action Sneak|CRB} and Deception checks to Impersonate.

effect: You grant allies within 100 feet a +2 status bonus to saves against {@spell fear|CRB} effects for 1 minute. When you activate this ability, each affected ally who’s {@condition frightened} reduces their {@condition frightened} value by 1.

entries: The armor is a +2 greater resilient breastplate. The item bonus and penalty increase to +3 and –3, respectively.

item.name: Celestial Armor
entries: This suit of +2 resilient chain mail is made of fine white links of a strange and slightly translucent pale metal, and the sleeves and skirt are fashioned into smaller trails that resemble feathers. Unlike normal chain mail, celestial armor has no Speed reduction, its armor check penalty is 0, and its Bulk is 1.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws against fiends. You appear radiant while you wear the armor, giving you a +2 item bonus to Diplomacy checks against all creatures except fiends.
If you are not good, you are {@condition drained} 2 while wearing celestial armor. You can’t recover from this condition while wearing the armor.

effect: The armor sprouts glowing wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet. The wings shed bright light in a 40-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet). The wings fade away after 10 minutes.

item.craft_requirements: You are good.

item.name: Demon Armor
entries: Crafted from black iron, this crude suit of +2 resilient full plate is designed to make you look like a horned demon, with your face peering out of the screaming maw of the beast.

While wearing the armor, you can attack with the helmet’s horns. They are a martial melee weapon with the effects of a +2 weapon potency rune. They deal {@dice 2d8} piercing damage and have the deadly d12 trait. On a critical hit with the horns, the target must attempt a DC 30 Fortitude save against the {@spell Abyssal plague|CRB} disease (page 316). The horns can’t be etched with any runes.
If you aren’t evil, you’re {@condition drained} 2 and can’t recover from this condition while wearing demon armor.

effect: You cast {@spell dimension door|CRB}.

item.craft_requirements: You are evil; supply one casting of {@spell dimension door|CRB}.

item.name: Dragonplate
entries: This suit of +2 greater resilient dragonhide full plate makes you look like a fearsome dragon. The armor comes in 10 varieties corresponding to the 10 common dragon types, though other varieties undoubtedly exist.

effect: You unleash a bout of {@spell dragon breath|CRB} with a shape, damage type, and saving throw corresponding to the type of dragon used to make the armor (shown on the table below). The breath weapon deals {@dice 14d6} damage; each creature in the area must attempt a DC 36 basic saving throw.

item.name: Electric Eelskin
entries: Shining, slippery eelskin covers the plates of this +1 resilient greater slick leather armor. The armor gives you the ability to breathe water and grants you a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks to {@action Swim|CRB} and Stealth checks you attempt in the water.

effect: You cast a 2nd-level {@spell shocking grasp|CRB} with a DC of 29.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell shocking grasp|CRB}.

item.name: Mail Of Luck
entries: This suit of +2 resilient splint mail has a large, green gemstone inset in a prominent location.

entries.trigger: You are hit or critically hit with an attack, but damage hasn’t been rolled yet;
effect: You force the attacker to reroll the attack roll and use the worse result. This effect has the misfortune trait.

Activating the armor causes the gemstone to turn gray and become inert. You cannot activate the armor again until the stone returns to its original green color. The gem turns green again after 1 week or when a significant foe critically succeeds at an attack roll targeting you. (If an enemy rolls a critical success at an attack against you and you force the attacker to reroll that critical success, that critical success does not recharge the mail of luck.) Even if the armor’s power returns before a week has elapsed, it can’t be activated more than once per day.

item.name: Moonlit Chain
entries: This +1 silver chain shirt has a collar adorned with stitched images of the phases of the moon. You can see in moonlight as though you had low-light vision.

effect: You touch the stitched image of the new moon on the armor’s collar and suppress the {@condition dazzled} condition for 1 minute.

item.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include 33 gp of silver.

item.name: Plate Armor Of The Deep
entries: This suit of +2 greater resilient full plate is decorated with swirling, ornate motifs of waves and fish scales. While wearing it, you take no Speed reduction or check penalty from armor when Swimming, gain a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks to {@action Swim|CRB}, can breathe underwater, and can speak Aquan.

item.name: Rhino Hide
entries: This +1 resilient hide armor is made from rhinoceros hide. It has an armor check penalty of –1 instead of –3. When you use the Sudden Charge class feat while wearing this armor, your {@action Strike|CRB} deals an additional {@dice 1d8} damage.
item.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include 320 gp of rhinoceros hide (a common material).

item.name: Ghoul Hide
entries: Stitched together from pieces of ghoul skin, this suit of +1 hide armor grants you a +1 item bonus to saving throws against disease and paralysis and makes you immune to the paralysis of ghouls. Ghoul hide with a resilient rune increases the resilient rune’s item bonus to saving throws against disease and paralysis by 1 (maximum +4)
Ghoul hide hisses with sibilant hatred at the touch of elves. When worn by a creature with the elf trait, the armor gains the noisy trait.

item.name: Impenetrable Scale
entries: Made of overlapping, lustrous black scales of standard-grade adamantine, this +2 greater resilient fortification adamantine scale mail seems to momentarily thicken at the point of impact when hit. Whenever the armor’s fortification rune successfully turns a significant foe’s critical hit into a normal hit, one of the scales on the armor turns violet. You gain resistance to physical damage equal to the number of violet scales, to a maximum of 8.
At dawn each day, all the violet scales return to normal.
item.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include 1,600 gp of adamantine.

item.name: Beacon Shot
entries: The shaft of a beacon shot is studded with tiny flecks of glimmering gemstones. When an activated beacon shot hits a target, it embeds itself into that target and spews sparks for 1 minute. If the target is {@condition invisible}, it becomes merely {@condition hidden} to creatures who would otherwise be unable to see it. The sparks also negate the {@condition concealed} condition if the target was otherwise {@condition concealed}.
A creature can remove the arrow or bolt by using an {@action Interact|CRB} basic action and succeeding at a DC 20 Athletics check.

item.name: Climbing Bolt
entries: The shaft of this bolt is wrapped with fine twine. When the bolt strikes a solid surface, the twine unwinds and enlarges into a 50-foot-long rope, securely fastened to the surface the bolt struck. The rope can be pulled free with an {@action Interact|CRB} action and a successful DC 20 Athletics check.

item.name: Disintegration Bolt
entries: The shaft of this bolt is scorched and blackened, and handling it coats your fingers with a fine black powder. When an activated disintegration bolt hits a target, it is subject to a {@spell disintegrate|CRB} spell requiring a DC 34 Fortitude save. As with the spell, a critical hit on the attack roll causes the target’s saving throw outcome to be one degree worse.
item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell disintegrate|CRB}.

item.name: Explosive Ammunition
entries: This piece of ammunition is coated in gritty black soot. When activated explosive ammunition hits a target, the missile explodes in a 10-foot burst, dealing {@dice 6d6} fire damage to each creature in the area (including the target). Each creature must attempt a DC 25 basic Reflex save.
The damage is {@dice 10d6} and the save DC is 30.

item.name: Ghost Ammunition
entries: Ghost ammunition is cool to the touch. This ammunition has the benefits of the ghost touch property rune and can fly through any obstacle except those that can block incorporeal creatures or effects. Though the ammunition penetrates barriers and ignores all cover, the target still benefits from the flat check from being {@condition concealed} or {@condition hidden}. You still can’t target an {@condition undetected} creature without guessing.
After it is launched, the ammunition vanishes into mist.
However, in the dead of the night {@dice 1d4} days later, it reappears in the last quiver or other container it was taken from.

item.name: Penetrating Ammunition
entries: This ammunition has a slender shape and a viciously pointed tip. When you activate and shoot penetrating ammunition, the {@action Strike|CRB} takes the shape of a 60-foot line originating from you.

Roll one attack roll and compare the result to the AC of each target in the line. The ammunition ignores up to 10 of a target’s resistance, and it can penetrate walls up to 1 foot thick with Hardness 10 or less. Each target that takes damage from this ammunition also takes {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}.

If your attack roll result is a natural 20, you improve your degree of success only against the first target in the line, but you can still score a critical hit on other targets if your result exceeds their AC by 10 or more. If you have access to your bow’s critical specialization effect, penetrating ammunition applies that effect only against a target in the last square of the line.

item.name: Shining Ammunition
entries: A piece of shining ammunition gives off a faint glow. When shot, this ammunition sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 10 minutes. If it hits a target, it sticks, causing the target to shed light in the same radius. A creature can remove the ammunition with an {@action Interact|CRB} action, but the ammunition itself continues to glow for the rest of the duration or until destroyed.

item.name: Sleep Arrow
entries: {@spell Sleep|CRB} arrows often have shafts of deep blue or black, and their fletching is exceptionally soft and downy. An activated {@spell sleep|CRB} arrow deals no damage, but a living creature hit by it is subject to the effects of a {@spell sleep|CRB} spell (DC 17).
item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell sleep|CRB}.

item.name: Spellstrike Ammunition
entries: Mystic patterns create a magic reservoir within this ammunition. You activate spellstrike ammunition by Casting a Spell into the ammunition. The spell must be of a spell level the ammunition can hold, and the spell must be able to target a creature other than the caster. A creature hit by activated spellstrike ammunition is targeted by the spell. If the creature isn’t a valid target for the spell, the spell is lost.

The ammunition affects only the target hit, even if the spell would normally affect more than one target. If the spell requires a spell attack roll, use the result of your ranged attack roll with the ammunition to determine the degree of success of the spell. If the spell requires a saving throw, the target attempts the save against your spell DC.
The maximum level of spell the ammunition can hold determines its item level and Price.
Maximum Spell Level 1st.
Maximum Spell Level 2nd.
Maximum Spell Level 3rd.
Maximum Spell Level 4th.
Maximum Spell Level 5th.
Maximum Spell Level 6th.
Maximum Spell Level 7th.
Maximum Spell Level 8th.
Maximum Spell Level 9th.

item.name: Stone Bullet
entries: This sling bullet looks like a {@condition petrified} serpent’s eye. A creature hit by an activated stone bullet is subject to the effects of a 6th-level {@spell flesh to stone|CRB} spell (DC 34).
item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell flesh to stone|CRB}.

item.name: Storm Arrow
entries: The head of this arrow is made from gleaming copper.

When an activated storm arrow hits a target, it is buffeted by raging winds and struck by a bolt of lightning that deals {@dice 3d12} electricity damage and the target must attempt a DC 25 Reflex saving throw. If this arrow is shot from a weapon with a shock property rune, the save DC increases to 27, though the attack doesn’t benefit from the shock property rune itself.

entries.Success: The foe takes half damage and isn’t affected by the wind.
entries.Failure: The foe takes full damage and is buffeted by winds for 1 round, taking a –2 circumstance penalty to ranged attack rolls and a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its fly Speed.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the foe takes double damage.

item.name: Vine Arrow
entries: Leafy stalks protrude from the shaft of this rustic arrow. When an activated vine arrow hits a target, the arrow’s shaft splits and grows, wrapping the target in vines. The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for {@dice 2d4} rounds, or until it Escapes against a DC of 19. On a critical hit, the target is also {@condition immobilized} until it Escapes.

item.name: Viper Arrow
entries: The shaft of this arrow is covered in fine green scales, and its iron head comes to a pair of points almost like fangs. After an activated viper arrow hits a target, the arrow transforms into a viper (Pathfinder Bestiary 302). The target is affected by the viper’s poison, as if it had been bitten. The viper then lands in an open space adjacent to the target.

The viper has the summoned trait and acts at the end of your turn, even though you didn’t use the {@action Sustain a Spell|CRB} action. It is under the GM’s control, but it generally attacks the creature the arrow struck. The viper vanishes after 1 minute or when slain.
item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell summon animal|CRB}.

item.name: Antimagic Oil
entries: This oil contains energy that repels nearly all types of magic.

When you apply this oil to armor, the creature wearing the armor becomes immune to all spells, effects of magic items (the wearer’s and those of others), and effects with the magical trait for 1 minute. The oil affects neither the magic of the armor nor the fundamental runes of weapons attacking the wearer.
Magical effects from a source of 20th level or higher, such as a deity, still function on the armor’s wearer.

item.name: Aligned Oil
entries: This oil fills a weapon with cosmic power of an alignment. Each aligned oil is crafted to one alignment: chaos, evil, good, or law (such as a good-aligned oil). A weapon anointed with this oil gains the effects of the property rune matching its alignment: anarchic (chaos), axiomatic (law), holy (good), or unholy (evil)
This lasts for 1 minute.

item.name: Nectar Of Purification
entries: A shimmering liquid, nectar of purification is often stored in bottles similar to those used for vinegar. This oil casts a 1st-level {@spell purify food and drink|CRB} spell over any food or drink onto which it’s poured. The nectar evaporates as it takes effect, leaving the taste and texture of the food or drink unaltered.

item.name: Obfuscation Oil
entries: You can spread this blue-gray gel on a single item with a Bulk of 3 or less to ward it against magical detection. It becomes immune to divination magic of 8th level or lower (such as {@spell locate|CRB}). This oil is permanent, but it can be removed with acid.
Removing the oil in this way usually takes 1 minute for objects with Bulk of 1 or less, or a number of minutes equal to the item’s Bulk.

item.name: Oil Of Animation
entries: You can rub this bronze-colored oil onto a melee weapon to grant it the benefits of the dancing rune (page 583). Once you fail a flat check for the weapon, causing it to fall, this effect ends.

item.name: Oil Of Keen Edges
entries: When this silvery salve is applied to a melee weapon that deals piercing or slashing damage, the weapon grows sharper and more dangerous for 1 minute, granting it the benefits of the keen rune.

item.name: Oil Of Mending
entries: A vial of oil of {@spell mending|CRB} appears to have countless translucent threads swirling within. Applying this oil to an item casts a 2nd-level {@spell mending|CRB} spell to repair the item.

item.name: Oil Of Potency
entries: When you apply this thick, viscous oil to a non-magical weapon or suit of armor, that item immediately becomes magically potent. If the item is a weapon, it temporarily becomes a +1 striking weapon, or, if it’s armor, it temporarily becomes +1 resilient armor. This lasts for 1 minute.

item.name: Oil Of Repulsion
entries: This oil contains magnetically charged iron filings repelled into opposite ends of the vial. For 1 minute after you apply this oil to armor, any creature that hits you with a melee {@action Strike|CRB} must attempt a DC 28 Fortitude save with the following effects.

entries.Failure: The creature is pushed up to 10 feet away from you (the GM determines the direction).
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and the creature is also knocked {@condition prone}.

item.name: Oil Of Weightlessness
entries: You can spread this shimmering oil on an item of 1 Bulk or less to make it feel weightless. It has negligible Bulk for 1 hour.
This oil can affect an item of 2 Bulk or less and lasts 8 hours.

item.name: Salve Of Antiparalysis
entries: Applying this filmy salve to a creature helps it overcome magical paralysis. The creature recovers as if it were the target of a 3rd-level {@spell remove paralysis|CRB} spell.

A greater salve of antiparalysis can potentially remove petrification. The creature recovers as if it were the target of both a 6th-level {@spell remove paralysis|CRB} spell and a stone to flesh spell.

item.name: Salve Of Slipperiness
entries: This greenish, persistent {@spell grease|CRB} can be applied to armor to make it extremely slippery for 8 hours, granting the wearer a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to {@action Escape|CRB} or to {@action Squeeze|CRB}.

item.name: Barkskin Potion
entries: After you drink this bitter draft, your skin thickens like bark. You gain the effects of a 2nd-level {@spell barkskin|CRB} spell for 10 minutes.

item.name: Dragon’s Breath Potion
entries: This liquid contains blood from a certain type of dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a breath weapon used by that type of dragon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion’s type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.
This potion has the trait matching the damage type of the breath weapon.
Exhaling {@spell dragon breath|CRB} uses a single action. The damage type and the area of the {@spell dragon breath|CRB} depend on the type of dragon blood in the potion, as shown in the table below.
Regardless of the dragon type, the breath weapon deals {@dice 4d6} damage, and each creature in the area must attempt a DC 23 basic save of a type determined by the type of the dragon.
After you use the breath weapon, you can’t do so again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
The damage is {@dice 6d6} and the save DC is 29.
The damage is {@dice 10d6} and the save DC is 37.
Dragon.

item.name: Healing Potion
entries: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker’s wounds {@spell heal|CRB} rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain the listed number of Hit Points.
The potion restores {@dice 1d8} Hit Points.
The potion restores {@dice 2d8+5} Hit Points.
The potion restores {@dice 3d8+10} Hit Points.
The potion restores {@dice 6d8+20} Hit Points.
The potion restores {@dice 8d8+30} Hit Points.

item.name: Invisibility Potion
entries: An {@spell invisibility|CRB} potion is colorless and oddly lightweight. Upon drinking it, you gain the effects of a 2nd-level {@spell invisibility|CRB} spell.

item.name: Panacea
entries: This potion appears to shift colors, and no two observers describe it in the same way. When consumed, it attempts to counteract all curses and diseases affecting you, as well as the {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} conditions from spells affecting you.
The potion has a counteract level of 7 and a +20 modifier for the roll.

item.name: Potion Of Flying
entries: Upon drinking this effervescent concoction, you gain a fly Speed of 40 feet for 1 minute.
The fly Speed lasts for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion Of Leaping
entries: For 1 minute after you drink this fizzy potion, whenever you {@action Leap|CRB}, you gain the effect of the 1st-level {@spell jump|CRB} spell.

item.name: Potion Of Quickness
entries: Drinking this silver potion grants you the effects of {@spell haste|CRB} for 1 minute.

item.name: Potion Of Resistance
entries: Drinking this thick, fortifying potion grants resistance against a single damage type for 1 hour. Each potion of resistance is created to defend against acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage (and is called a lesser potion of fire resistance or the like).
You gain resistance 5 to the appropriate energy type.
You gain resistance 10 to the appropriate energy type.
You gain resistance 15 to the appropriate energy type.

item.name: Potion Of Swimming
entries: This potion tastes like salt water, and sandy grit settles to the bottom of its container. When you drink it, you gain a swim Speed equal to your land Speed for 10 minutes.
The swim Speed lasts for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion Of Tongues
entries: This sour potion enlivens your tongue with unusual flavors and uncommon eloquence, allowing you to speak and understand all languages for 4 hours after you drink it. This doesn’t allow you to read these languages in their written form.

item.name: Potion Of Undetectability
entries: Drinking this dull-black liquid makes you undetectable to divinations. This grants the same effects as {@spell mind blank|CRB}, but without the bonus against mental effects. You also gain the effects of a 4th-level {@spell invisibility|CRB} spell, which protects against {@spell see invisibility|CRB} spells of 8th level and lower and has a DC of 36 against {@spell true seeing|CRB}. The potion’s effects last for 10 minutes.

item.name: Potion Of Water Breathing
entries: This filmy, gray potion smells of an old fish midden and tastes even worse. After drinking this potion, you gain the effects of a 2nd-level {@spell water breathing|CRB} spell for 1 hour.

item.name: Shrinking Potion
entries: This fungus-flavored potion conveys the effects of the {@spell shrink|CRB} spell to make you and all your gear smaller. After the onset, you remain small for 10 minutes.
This potion has no onset, lasts for 1 hour, and grants the effects of a 4th-level {@spell shrink|CRB} spell. In addition, you gain a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks while shrunken.

item.name: Serum Of Sex Shift
entries: Upon drinking this potion, your biology instantly transforms to take on a set of sexual characteristics of your choice, changing your appearance and physiology accordingly. You have mild control over the details of this change, but you retain a strong “family resemblance” to your former appearance.

The magic functions instantaneously and can’t be counteracted. Your new anatomy is as healthy and functional as your previous body’s, potentially allowing you to procreate (depending on your ancestry’s biology). Drinking a subsequent serum of sex shift allows you to either revert back to your original form or adopt other sexual characteristics, as you choose. The elixir has no effect if you are pregnant or from an ancestry with no sexual differentiation. Most ancestries have a wide spectrum of sexual differentiation, some common, others more rare.

item.name: Truesight Potion
entries: Upon drinking this clear, refreshing potion, you can see things as they actually are. You gain the benefits of a 7th-level true seeing spell that has a counteract modifier of +25.

item.name: Truth Potion
entries: For 10 minutes after drinking this astringent potion, you can’t intentionally lie and may be compelled to tell the truth.
Upon drinking the potion, attempt a DC 19 Will save. You can voluntarily fail or critically fail.

entries.Success: The potion does not affect you.
entries.Failure: When you speak, you must tell the truth.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and when someone asks you a question, you must attempt another DC 19 Will saving throw. If you fail this saving throw, you must answer the question truthfully if you are able to do so; if you succeed, you are temporarily immune to further attempts to ask the same question within the potion’s duration.

item.name: Scroll Of Glitterdust
entries: This scroll can be used to cast {@spell glitterdust|CRB} as a 2nd-level spell.
item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell glitterdust|CRB}.

item.name: Scroll Of Illusory Disguise
entries: This scroll can cast {@spell illusory disguise|CRB} as a 1st-level spell.
item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell illusory disguise|CRB}.

item.name: Bloodseeker Beak

activate.trigger: You hit a flat-footed creature with the affixed weapon.

entries: This long, hollow proboscis is harvested from the notorious bloodseeker beast and drips a trickle of blood. When you activate the beak, you deal an extra {@dice 1d4} precision damage on your damage roll. If you deal sneak attack damage to the creature, you also deal {@dice 1d4} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}.

item.name: Bronze Bull Pendant

activate.requirements: You are trained in Athletics.
activate.trigger: You attempt an Athletics check to Shove, but you haven’t rolled yet;

entries: This pendant is forged from grainy steel and depicts a snorting bull’s face. The pendant must be attached to the chest area or on a shoulder guard. When you activate the pendant, you gain a +2 status bonus to the Athletics check to {@action Shove|CRB}, and if you roll a critical failure on the check, you get a failure instead.

item.name: Crying Angel Pendant

activate.requirements: You are trained in Medicine.
activate.trigger: You critically fail to Administer

entries: When you activate this alabaster pendant, your critical failure becomes a normal failure instead.

item.name: Dazing Coil

activate.trigger: You deal damage to a flat-footed creature with the affixed weapon.

entries: This knot of copper wire reshapes itself in a new pattern every time its affixed weapon deals damage. When you activate the coil, the damaged creature must succeed at a DC 31 Will save or be {@condition stunned} 1. If it critically fails, it instead becomes {@condition stunned} 2.

item.name: Dispelling Sliver

activate.requirements: You’re a master with the affixed weapon.
activate.trigger: Your Strike damages a target;

entries: Made from a treated sliver of cold iron, this talisman allows you to counteract magical effects. When you activate the dispelling sliver, it attempts to counteract a single spell active on the target, with the effects of an 8th-level {@spell dispel magic|CRB} spell.
If you activate the talisman on a successful Dispelling Slice, the talisman attempts to counteract all spells active on the target.

item.name: Dragon Turtle Scale

activate.requirements: You’re an expert in Athletics.

entries: This shimmering green scale is usually attached to a golden clasp or chain. When you activate the scale, for 1 minute you gain a swim Speed equal to half your land Speed.

item.name: Effervescent Ampoule

activate.requirements: You’re an expert in Acrobatics.

entries: Light spring water fizzes and bubbles within this small glass globe, spilling onto the affixed armor when activated. Until the end of your turn, the armor lets you move across water and other liquids as if they were solid ground. If you {@action Stride|CRB} or {@action Step|CRB} over a weight-sensitive pressure plate, you don’t cause the plate to depress, which prevents you from triggering any device or hazard attached to the pressure plate. When the ampoule’s effect ends, you sink, fall, break through flimsy ground, or land on pressure plates as normal for your current location.

item.name: Emerald Grasshopper

activate.requirements: You are an expert in Athletics.
activate.trigger: You attempt a High Jump but haven’t rolled yet;

entries: This metal grasshopper studded with emeralds is usually clasped to the legs of a suit of armor. When you activate it, if you succeed at the Athletics check, you {@action Leap|CRB} up to 50 feet vertically and up to 10 feet horizontally. If you critically succeed, you can {@action Leap|CRB} up to 75 feet vertically and 20 feet horizontally. If you don’t end your {@spell jump|CRB} on solid ground, you flutter in the air until the end of your turn, then fall harmlessly at a rate of 60 feet per round until you reach the ground.

item.name: Eye Of Apprehension

activate.requirements: You are a master in Perception.
activate.trigger: You are about to roll Perception for initiative but haven’t rolled yet;

entries: This round piece of cymophane’s silky inclusion makes it look like a cat’s eye. While affixed, it makes you jittery. When you activate it, roll Perception twice and use the higher result.

item.name: Fade Band

activate.requirements: You are a master in Stealth.
activate.trigger: An attack misses you;

entries: This thin, silvery wire wraps around your armor. When you activate the band, it casts a 2nd-level {@spell invisibility|CRB} spell on you.

item.name: Fear Gem
entries: Dark smoke seems to writhe within this obsidian gem. When you activate the gem, you make an Intimidating {@action Strike|CRB}, as the {@class fighter|CRB} feat (page 146)

If you have the Intimidating {@action Strike|CRB} feat, increase the {@condition frightened} condition value from this Intimidating {@action Strike|CRB} to {@condition frightened} 2, or {@condition frightened} 3 on a critical hit.

item.name: Feather Step Stone

activate.trigger: You Stride or Step;

entries: You are an expert in Acrobatics.
This stone, usually shaped as a cabochon, is a small chunk of amber with a bit of feather or a flying insect caught within it.
When you activate the stone, you ignore the effects of any difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain you move through until the end of your turn.

item.name: Flame Navette

activate.requirements: You’re an expert in Will saves.

entries: This piece of bronzite is shaped like an oval with points at both ends. It has a carved flame at its center and is traditionally worn over the heart. You can activate only one flame navette per day. When you activate the navette, you gain the benefit of the {@class fighter|CRB}’s Determination class feat, with a counteract modifier of +22. If you have the Determination feat, you can use your own modifier if it’s better.

item.name: Gallows Tooth

activate.requirements: You’re a master in Intimidation.
activate.trigger: You attack an adjacent creature and haven’t rolled your attack roll;

entries: This grisly molar hangs from a cord threaded through a tiny hole just above its dried, exposed root. When you activate this talisman, the creature you’re attacking becomes {@condition flat-footed} until the end of the current turn.

item.name: Ghost Dust

activate.requirements: You are legendary in Stealth.
activate.trigger: You use an action with the move trait;

entries: This small vial is filled with a grayish-green dust rendered from dried ectoplasm. When you activate the dust, it casts a 4th-level {@spell invisibility|CRB} spell on you. This comes into effect before you move during the triggering action.

item.name: Grim Trophy

activate.requirements: You are an expert in Intimidation.
activate.trigger: You attempt an Intimidation check to Coerce or Demoralize, but you haven’t rolled yet;

entries: This talisman comes in many forms, most often a severed piece of a humanoid creature displayed in some gruesome manner. When you activate the trophy, select two targets and compare your Intimidation check result to both of their DCs.

item.name: Hunter’s Bane

activate.requirements: You are trained in Survival.
activate.trigger: An undetected enemy hits you with an attack;

entries: This talisman is a ring of dried, interwoven leaves. When you activate the hunter’s {@spell bane|CRB}, you sense the exact location of the attacker, making it {@condition hidden} from you instead of {@condition undetected}. If the attacker is behind lead, the hunter’s {@spell bane|CRB} fails and is wasted.

item.name: Iron Cube

activate.requirements: You are an expert with the affixed weapon.

entries: This cube of blackened iron is affixed to a weapon with an iron chain. When you activate the cube, you use Knockdown, as the {@class fighter|CRB} feat (page 146)
If you have the Knockdown feat, ignore its normal size restrictions.

item.name: Iron Cudgel
entries: You are a master with the affixed weapon.

This miniature iron cudgel is typically affixed to a weapon by an iron chain. When you activate the cudgel, you use Brutal Finish, as the {@class fighter|CRB} feat (page 151). You must meet the normal requirements, including those of the press trait.
If you have the Brutal Finish feat, add two additional weapon damage dice on a success or a failure.

item.name: Iron Equalizer

activate.requirements: You are a master with the affixed weapon.

entries: This small iron band has a shifting weight that helps equalize the affixed weapon’s balance. When you activate it, you use Certain {@action Strike|CRB}, as the {@class fighter|CRB} feat (page 150). You must meet the normal requirements, including those of the press trait.
If you have the Certain {@action Strike|CRB} feat, the failure effect increases to deal the weapon’s normal damage.

item.name: Iron Medallion

activate.requirements: You have master proficiency in Will saves or have the bravery class feature.
activate.trigger: You attempt a

entries: This small medallion is shaped like a shield.

When you activate it, you gain a +2 status bonus to saves against {@spell fear|CRB} for 1 minute. On the triggering save, if the outcome of your roll is a failure, you get a success instead or if the outcome is a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

item.name: Jade Bauble

activate.requirements: You are a master with the affixed weapon.

entries: This bit of jade is usually carved in the shape of a duelist, or sometimes a multi-armed creature.

When you activate the bauble, it magically draws the attention of foes. Until the start of your next turn, enemies within the reach of the weapon the talisman is affixed to are {@condition flat-footed}.

item.name: Jade Cat

activate.trigger: You fall or attempt an Acrobatics check to Balance;

entries: You are trained in Acrobatics.

A thumb-sized feline carved of rare stone, the jade cat is typically worn as a pendant upon a suit of armor. For 1 minute after you activate the cat, you treat all falls as 20 feet shorter, you are not {@condition flat-footed} when you {@action Balance|CRB}, and narrow surfaces and uneven ground are not difficult terrain for you.

item.name: Mending Lattice
item.usage: affixed to a shield or weapon

activate.requirements: You are a master in Crafting.
activate.trigger: The affixed item would take damage;

entries: This lattice of reinforced iron is shaped into a perfect octagon. When you activate it, it negates the damage and instantly and completely repairs the affixed item.

item.name: Mesmerizing Opal

activate.trigger: You attempt a Deception check to Feint, but you haven’t rolled yet.

entries: This silver-bound opal pendant is afire with iridescence.
When you activate it, if the outcome of your triggering Deception check is a critical failure, you get a failure instead (or if the outcome is a success, you get a critical success instead).

item.name: Monkey Pin

activate.requirements: You are trained in

entries: This small brass pin is in the shape of a monkey climbing a tree. When you activate this talisman, use a {@action Climb|CRB} action.
If you succeed, you move your full Speed during the {@action Climb|CRB}. If you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

item.name: Mummified Bat

activate.requirements: You are a master in Perception.

entries: This talisman is the magically treated corpse of a tiny bat bound in papyrus. When you activate the bat, the affixed weapon detects vibrations around you and guides your perception. You gain the benefits of the {@class fighter|CRB} Blind-Fight class feat (page 149) for 1 minute.

If you have the Blind-Fight feat, you gain imprecise echolocation with a range of 30 feet for 1 minute. This makes creatures that would be {@condition undetected} by you because you can’t see them {@condition hidden} instead.

item.name: Murderer’s Knot

activate.requirements: You are an expert with the affixed weapon.
activate.trigger: You damage a flat-footed creature with a Strike using the affixed weapon;

entries: This black strand of leather is tied to look like a peace knot when the weapon is stowed, but it doesn’t hamper drawing the weapon. When you activate the knot, the creature you damaged takes {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}.
If you have the Twist the Knife feat, the talisman instead deals {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} equal to your sneak attack damage.

item.name: Onyx Panther

activate.requirements: You are trained in Stealth.
activate.trigger: You use a Sneak action;

entries: This small stone is a stylized panther shape. When you activate it, you can move your full Speed (instead of half) during the triggering {@action Sneak|CRB} and any other time you {@action Sneak|CRB} this turn.

item.name: Owlbear Claw

activate.trigger: You critically succeed at an attack roll with the affixed weapon.

entries: This claw set in an iron clasp and chain isn’t always the claw of an owlbear. When you activate the claw, the triggering attack gains the weapon’s critical specialization effect.

item.name: Potency Crystal

activate.trigger: You make an attack with the affixed weapon, but you haven’t rolled yet.

entries: This fluorite crystal glows with a strange phosphorescence.

When you activate the crystal, the weapon becomes a +1 striking weapon for the rest of the turn, gaining a +1 item bonus to the attack roll and increasing the damage on a hit to two weapon damage dice.

item.name: Savior Spike

activate.requirements: You’re an expert in Reflex.
activate.trigger: You attempt to Grab an Edge but haven’t rolled;

entries: This pyramid-shaped spike is attached to an armor’s chest piece. When you activate the spike, it shoots a strand of force to help you gain purchase. If you roll a success on the triggering attempt, you get a critical success instead (if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead).

item.name: Shark Tooth Charm

activate.requirements: You are an expert in Acrobatics.
activate.trigger: You attempt to Escape using Acrobatics for your roll, but you haven’t rolled yet;

entries: This dried seaweed bracelet is lined with charms shaped like small shark teeth. When you activate the bracelet, if you roll a success on the triggering check, you get a critical success instead (if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead). If you fail the Acrobatics check against a grabbing creature, the creature must either release you as a free action or take {@dice 2d8} piercing damage as shark’s teeth momentarily emerge from your skin.

item.name: Sneaky Key

activate.requirements: You are an expert in Thievery.

entries: This small silver skeleton key can be pinned to armor or a sleeve. When you turn the key to activate it, for the next minute, if the outcome of any your attempts to {@action Pick a {@spell Lock|CRB}|CRB} is a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

item.name: Swift Block Cabochon

activate.trigger: You take damage from a physical attack while you don’t have the affixed shield raised.

entries: This clear quartz cabochon attaches to the center of your shield. When you activate the cabochon, you use the Shield Block reaction even if you hadn’t raised the affixed shield (and even if you don’t normally have that reaction).

item.name: Tiger Menuki

activate.trigger: You Strike with the affixed weapon.

entries: This tiger formed of pewter snarls viciously from your weapon’s grip. When you activate the tiger, the affixed weapon gains the sweep trait for the triggering attack and all other attacks for 1 minute.

item.name: Vanishing Coin

activate.requirements: You are a master in Stealth.
activate.trigger: You attempt a Stealth check for initiative, but you haven’t rolled yet;

entries: This copper coin dangles from a leather strip strung through a hole drilled in the center. Until activated, the coin becomes {@condition invisible} for a few seconds at random intervals every few minutes. When you activate the coin, it casts a 2nd-level {@spell invisibility|CRB} spell on you, lasting until the end of your next turn.

item.name: Viper’s Fang

activate.trigger: A creature within your reach uses a manipulate or move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it’s using;

entries: You are a master with the affixed weapon.
When you activate this resin-strengthened viper skull, you make an {@action Attack of Opportunity|CRB} against the triggering creature.
If you have {@action Attack of Opportunity|CRB}, you can activate the viper’s fang as a free action.

item.name: Wolf Fang
entries: You successfully {@action Trip|CRB} a foe; Requirements You are trained in Athletics.

This wolf canine is bound in a strip of leather and tied to a buckle or strap of a suit of armor. When you activate the fang, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier to the target of your {@action Trip|CRB}. If your {@action Trip|CRB} would already deal physical damage that doesn’t include an ability modifier, add your Strength modifier to that damage.

item.name: Candle Of Truth
entries: This tapered candle has a golden wick that burns with white fire.
You activate the candle by lighting it, which causes creatures within 10 feet of the candle to find it difficult to tell falsehoods.
Creatures in the area receive a –4 status penalty to {@action Lie|CRB}.

In addition, when first entering the affected area, each creature (including you) must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or be unable to tell any deliberate lies while within 10 feet of the lit candle. This lasts for as long as the candle is lit. Once lit, the candle burns for 10 minutes, and it cannot be extinguished.

item.name: Dust Of Appearance
entries: Stored in a small reed, this powder looks like a fine metallic dust. When you fling it in the air, it coats all creatures in a 10-foot burst centered on a point within 5 feet of you. For 1 minute, the coated creatures can’t be {@condition concealed} or {@condition invisible}, nor can they benefit from {@spell mirror image|CRB} or similar abilities that create illusory duplicates. Any illusions in the area of 3rd level or lower are revealed as such, although this does not end their effect.

item.name: Dust Of Disappearance
entries: This powder shimmers like a thousand tiny motes of light.

Activating the dust by sprinkling it on yourself or a creature within reach casts a 4th-level {@spell invisibility|CRB} spell with a duration of 1 minute on that creature. This {@spell invisibility|CRB} can’t be negated or seen through by any spell of 3rd level or lower or any item of 5th level or lower.

item.name: Elemental Gem
entries: You shout the name of an elemental lord and dash this glassy gem against a hard surface to activate it. It cracks open, casting a 5th-level {@spell summon elemental|CRB} spell to summon forth an elemental you control as long as you spend an action each round to Sustain the Activation.
This gem comes in four varieties: transparent for a living whirlwind, light brown for a living landslide, reddish orange for a living wildfire, and blue-green for a living waterfall.

item.name: Feather Token
entries: Each feather token appears to be a simple feather from some exotic bird. The feather’s shaft, dipped in gold, bears a single arcane rune. Activating a feather token causes it to transform into another object, which then can be used as normal for that object. Each feather can be activated only once, with most of them permanently becoming the item in their description.

This feather can be activated only on a boat. When activated, this feather transforms into a massive anchor that causes the boat to immediately stop. After 1 day, the anchor vanishes and the boat can move as normal. The anchor is attached to the boat by a magical chain of force, but the chain can be removed by {@spell dispel magic|CRB} or destroyed (Hardness 30, HP 40).

When activated, this token transforms into a small sparrow that waits on your finger for you to relay a {@spell message|CRB} up to 1 minute in length, along with the name and rough location of a recipient.

The recipient must be someone you have met, and the location must be somewhere you have visited. After receiving the {@spell message|CRB}, the bird flies off to deliver it, traveling at 30 miles per hour and then searching for the target in the location you provided. If the bird finds the target, it moves adjacent to them, your words emanate from the bird, and the bird then flies off and vanishes. The bird also vanishes if it fails to find your target after 10 hours of searching the location you specified.
