When you use this token, a small wooden chest appears and immediately opens. This chest can hold up to 10 Bulk worth of items. Once the chest is closed, it transforms again—this time into a key—taking all of the stored items with it. You can activate this key by spending an {@action Interact|CRB} action to turn it in an imaginary {@spell lock|CRB}, which causes it to transform back into a chest with all of the items still inside. Once it has turned into a chest a second time, it forever remains a wooden chest.
Activating this feather requires you to fan it in a given direction.

If this direction is toward the sail of a vessel, the feather flutters up toward the sail and fans continuously, filling the sail with air and granting the vessel a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed for 8 hours. If fanned in any other direction, it instead produces a single casting of {@spell gust of wind|CRB} (DC 20).

When this feather is activated, it immediately transforms into a living holly bush, filling a single square. This bush can provide standard cover. In addition, the bush has {@dice 2d4} bright-red berries.

While holly berries are usually poisonous, these berries are infused with beneficial magic. You can pick and eat a berry as an {@action Interact|CRB} action to recover 1 Hit Point. Once plucked from the bush, a berry becomes non-magical after a few seconds, so it doesn’t {@spell heal|CRB} you if you don’t eat it within the span of your {@action Interact|CRB} action.
If activated on soil, the plant continues to grow and thrive (although it doesn’t produce any more healing berries). If activated elsewhere, it withers and dies within {@dice 1d4} days.
When activated, this feather transforms permanently into a 20-foot-long wooden ladder.

This feather can be activated only when tossed into a large body of water, such as a lake or broad river. It transforms into a swan-shaped boat capable of carrying up to 32 Medium creatures, 8 Large creatures, or 2 Huge creatures. The boat moves on the water at a Speed of 50 feet, and lasts 1 day.

This token can be activated only on an unoccupied patch of earth or soil. When activated, this token transforms into an oak tree, 60 feet tall with a 5-foot-wide trunk. The tree continues to live and grow if conditions are favorable.

This feather transforms into a +1 striking dancing whip when activated. The whip immediately jumps from your grasp and proceeds to attack your enemies until 1 minute has passed or it fails its flat check for dancing, at which point it vanishes.

If the whip’s target isn’t {@condition prone}, the whip uses its actions to attempt to {@action Trip|CRB} that creature instead of making a {@action Strike|CRB}. The whip’s total attack modifier for Striking or Tripping is +18 instead of the normal bonus for a dancing weapon.

item.name: Holy Water
entries: This vial contains water blessed by a good deity. You activate a vial of holy water by throwing it as a {@action Strike|CRB}. It’s a simple thrown weapon with a range increment of 20 feet. Unlike an alchemical bomb, it doesn’t add the manipulate trait to the attack made with it.
Holy water deals {@dice 1d6} good damage and 1 good splash damage. It damages only fiends, undead, and creatures that have a weakness to good damage.

item.name: Javelin Of Lightning
entries: This item looks like a normal javelin carved with lightning-bolt motifs. If thrown without being activated, it wobbles in the air and fails to strike true. When you Activate the javelin, your {@spell command|CRB} makes the carvings crackle with electricity. You then hurl the javelin. It shatters immediately after leaving your hand and unleashes its magic as a 4th-level {@spell lightning bolt|CRB} originating from your space. The bolt deals {@dice 5d12} electricity damage and has a Reflex save DC of 25.
item.craft_requirements: Supply a casting of {@spell lightning bolt|CRB} (4th level).

item.name: Runestone
entries: This flat piece of hard stone is specially prepared for etching a magical fundamental rune or property rune. You can etch only one rune upon a stone. Once the stone is etched, it gains the magic school trait of the rune etched upon it. When a rune is transferred from the runestone to another object, the runestone cracks and is destroyed. The Price listed is for an empty stone; a stone holding a rune adds the Price of the rune.

item.name: Unholy Water
entries: An evil deity’s malice lies within this vial of water. You activate a vial of unholy water by throwing it as a {@action Strike|CRB}. It’s a simple thrown weapon with a range increment of 20 feet. Unlike an alchemical bomb, it doesn’t add the manipulate trait to the attack made with it.
Unholy water deals {@dice 1d6} evil damage and 1 evil splash damage.
It damages only celestials and creatures that have a weakness to evil damage.

item.name: Bag Of Holding
entries: Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn’t change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The amount of Bulk the bag’s extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

You can {@action Interact|CRB} with the bag of holding to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

If the bag is overloaded or {@condition broken}, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it’s turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to {@action Escape|CRB} against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it’s retrieved first. An item in the bag can’t be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.
Capacity 25 Bulk.
Capacity 50 Bulk.
Capacity 100 Bulk.
Capacity 150 Bulk.

item.name: Bottled Air
entries: Appearing to be an ordinary corked glass bottle, this item contains a limitless supply of fresh air. You must uncork the bottle with an {@action Interact|CRB} action before you can activate it.

effect: You draw a breath of air from the bottle. This allows you to breathe even in an airless or toxic environment. Air doesn’t escape the mouth of the bottle, so leaving the open bottle in an airless environment doesn’t change the environment.

item.name: Broom Of Flying
entries: This broom has a tenuous connection to gravity, and it tends to drift even while stowed. You can ride on the broom using one hand to guide it, and the broom can carry up to one passenger in addition to you. The broom moves at a fly Speed of 20 feet.
The broom can carry only so much, taking a –10‑foot penalty to its Speed if laden with more than 20 Bulk, and crashing to the ground if it carries more than 30 Bulk.

effect: You name a destination on the same plane, and the broom speeds toward it at a fly Speed of 40 feet. You must either clutch the broom with two hands in order to ride it, or you need to release the broom to send it off with no rider. If you don’t have a good idea of the location, layout, and general direction of the destination, or if your named destination is on another plane, the broom wanders aimlessly, circling back to its starting location after 30 minutes.
If the broom carries a rider, this activation lasts until 4 hours pass (typically 16 miles of travel), the broom reaches its destination, or you {@action Dismiss|CRB} the activation.
If the broom doesn’t have a rider, the activation lasts until the broom reaches its destination. When the activation ends, the broom floats to the ground and can’t be activated again for 1 hour.

item.name: Chime Of Opening
entries: This hollow mithral tube is about a foot long and bears engravings reminiscent of open locks and {@condition broken} chains.
The chime can be activated 10 times before it cracks and becomes useless.

effect: You aim the chime at a container, door, or {@spell lock|CRB} you want to open and strike the chime. The chime sends out magical vibrations that attempt a Thievery check against the {@spell lock|CRB}’s DC, with a Thievery bonus of +13. This targets only one {@spell lock|CRB} or binding at a time, so you might need to activate the chime multiple times to open a target with several forms of {@spell protection|CRB}.

item.name: Crystal Ball
entries: This polished crystal sphere enhances {@spell scrying|CRB} magic. Any visual information received through a spell with the {@spell scrying|CRB} trait that was cast by the crystal ball appears within the sphere, and any auditory information sounds out from the surface of the sphere. When you cast a {@spell scrying|CRB} spell by any other means while holding the sphere, you can relay any information you receive in the same way, allowing others to see or hear the target.
The base version of a crystal ball is a sphere of clear quartz, but other versions are made of different stones.

effect: The crystal ball casts {@spell clairvoyance|CRB} to your specifications.
The crystal ball casts a DC 33 {@spell scrying|CRB} spell to your specifications.

entries: {@spell Scrying|CRB} is DC 36 and gives you the benefits of {@spell see invisibility|CRB} on the target.
{@spell Scrying|CRB} is DC 37 and gives you the benefits of {@spell mind reading|CRB} on the target, using the same save DC.
{@spell Scrying|CRB} is DC 39 and gives you the benefits of {@spell telepathy|CRB} for communicating with the target.
{@spell Scrying|CRB} is DC 41 and gives you the benefits of {@spell true seeing|CRB} for anything you watch through it.

item.name: Decanter Of Endless Water
entries: This item looks like an ordinary glass flask full of water.

The stopper can’t be removed unless you speak one of the item’s three {@spell command|CRB} words, each of which causes water to pour forth in a different way. Pulling the stopper straight out creates fresh water, and rotating it as you pull creates salt water. Any effect of the decanter lasts until the decanter is plugged (with its own stopper, a finger, or the like).

effect: Speaking “stream,” you cause water to pour out at a rate of 1 gallon per round.
Speaking “fountain,” you cause water to pour out in a 5-foot-long stream at a rate of 5 gallons per round.

Speaking “geyser,” you cause a powerful deluge of water to erupt at a rate of 15 gallons per round. You can direct the stream at a creature, subjecting it to the effects of hydraulic push (spell attack roll +15). You can repeat this once per round as long as the geyser continues, spending an {@action Interact|CRB} action to direct the geyser each time.

item.name: Everburning Torch
entries: An everburning torch is one of the most common applications of permanent magic. This torch sheds light constantly, requiring no oxygen and generating no heat.
The flame can be covered or {@condition hidden}, but can’t be smothered or quenched.

item.name: Holy Prayer Beads
entries: This strand of ordinary-looking prayer beads glows with a soft light and becomes warm to the touch the first time you cast a divine spell while holding it. When you do, the prayer beads become attuned to your deity, changing their form and iconography to prominently incorporate your deity’s religious symbol and iconography. The beads don’t transform or function for an evil spellcaster.

Whenever you cast a divine spell from your own spell slots while holding the prayer beads, you recover 1 Hit Point; this is a positive healing effect. If the spell you cast was a healing spell, you can grant this additional healing to one of the spell’s targets instead of yourself.

effect: Cast {@spell bless|CRB} or {@spell heal|CRB}, each once per day.

variants.craft_requirements: You have a spellcasting class feature with the divine tradition.
entries: You recover {@dice 1d4} Hit Points instead of 1 Hit Point when casting divine spells from your spell slots.

Change the beads’ list of spells to the 4th-level versions of {@spell bless|CRB}, {@spell divine wrath|CRB} (matching one component of your deity’s alignment), {@spell heal|CRB}, neutralize poison, and {@spell remove disease|CRB}. You can cast each of these once per day.

item.name: Horn Of Blasting
entries: A horn of blasting is a bright brass trumpet. It can be played as an instrument, granting a +2 item bonus to your Performance check.

effect: When you activate the horn by blowing into it with destructive intent, you create a blast note targeting one creature or object within 30 feet. The blast deals {@dice 3d6} sonic damage. (DC 28 basic Fortitude save).
You can blow even louder to create an intense blast wave in a 30-foot cone that deals {@dice 8d6} sonic damage. Each creature attempts a DC 28 Fortitude save with the following effects.

entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition deafened} for {@dice 2d6} rounds.

item.name: Horn Of Fog
entries: This large ram’s horn perpetually glistens with tiny droplets of water, much like condensation.

effect: You activate the horn by blowing deeply into it, causing it to issue forth a low blast and cast a 2nd-level {@spell obscuring mist|CRB} spell. You can {@action Dismiss|CRB} the mist at any time by blowing a second note on the horn using an {@action Interact|CRB} action.

item.name: Immovable Rod
entries: This flat iron bar is almost completely nondescript, except for one small button appearing on its surface.

effect: You push the button to anchor the rod in place. It doesn’t move, defying gravity if need be. If the button is pushed again, the rod deactivates, ending the anchoring magic. While anchored, the rod can be moved only if 8,000 pounds of pressure are applied to it or if a creature uses Athletics to {@action Force Open|CRB} the rod with a DC of 40 (though most intelligent creatures can just push the button to release the rod).

item.name: Maestro’s Instrument
entries: A maestro’s instrument can be crafted in the form of any variety of handheld musical instrument. A maestro’s instrument grants you a +1 item bonus to Performance checks while playing music with the instrument.

effect: You can play the instrument to produce the effects of a {@spell charm|CRB} spell.

entries: The item bonus is +2, and the {@spell charm|CRB} spell is 4th level.

variants.craft_requirements: You must supply a casting of {@spell charm|CRB} of the appropriate level.
entries: The item bonus is +3, and the {@spell charm|CRB} spell is 8th level.

item.name: Marvelous Medicines
entries: This set of healer’s tools contains a seemingly endless supply of bandages, herbs, and healing items of impeccable quality, granting you a +2 item bonus to Medicine checks.

effect: You can activate the tools when you use them to {@action Treat Poison|CRB} in order to produce the effects of neutralize poison, or when you {@action Treat Disease|CRB} in order to produce the effects of {@spell remove disease|CRB}. Once these medicines have been used to treat a patient’s poison or disease, they can’t be used again to treat the same affliction for that patient.

entries: The tools grant a +3 item bonus, and the spells are heightened to 6th level.

item.name: Possibility Tome
entries: An array of semiprecious stones is set into the ornate silver and beaten copper cover of this thick and weighty tome. If you open the book before it’s been activated, its vellum pages are blank and pristine, but once activated, words dance and swim onto the pages before your eyes.

effect: As you flip through the book, you think about a broad topic you want to know more about. Choose one skill: Arcana, Crafting, Medicine, Nature, Occultism, Religion, Society, or a single subcategory of Lore. The book’s pages fill with information about that skill, though only you can see the information. While the pages are full, you can spend an {@action Interact|CRB} action perusing the book just before attempting a check to Recall Knowledge with the chosen skill. This grants you a +3 item bonus to the check, and if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.
The information within the book disappears after 24 hours or when the tome is activated again.

item.name: Primeval Mistletoe
entries: This sprig of berry-festooned holly and mistletoe doesn’t wilt or rot. It can be used as a primal focus, and it also grants the creature holding it a +1 item bonus to Nature checks.

effect: You squeeze juice from one of the berries and smear it onto a non-magical club or staff to cast {@spell shillelagh|CRB} upon it.
You can twine the sprig around the wrist of one hand and touch a tree to cast {@spell tree shape|CRB} upon yourself, except instead of a becoming a tree, you become a vine on the touched tree.

entries: The sprig grants a +2 bonus and can be activated in one additional way: Activate {@as 2} {@action Interact|CRB}; Frequency once per day; Effect You plant the primeval mistletoe into an area of natural earth or stone. Once planted, the plant immediately sprouts into an area of holly bushes that don’t impede movement and that pulse with positive energy, replicating the effects of a {@spell field of life|CRB} spell. This lasts for up to 1 minute, as long as you continue to Sustain the Activation. When this magic ends, the holly bushes revert back into the original primeval mistletoe.

item.name: Rod Of Negation
entries: This long, plain, leaden rod can disrupt magic.

effect: This rod emits a thin, gray beam that negates a spell or magic item, casting a 6th-level {@spell dispel magic|CRB} spell with a counteract modifier of +23. Once activated, the rod can’t be activated again for {@dice 2d6} hours.

item.name: Rod Of Wonder
entries: This peculiar rod is strange and unpredictable. Each time it is activated, it produces one of a variety of effects at random.

effect: Choose a creature within 60 feet and roll d% on the table below to determine the rod’s effect. If an entry lists only a spell name, the rod casts that spell at its lowest level. You make any decisions for a spell cast by the rod unless otherwise indicated, except that it must target the creature you chose, or the creature you chose must be the center of the spell’s area, if it has an area but no targets. If the spell’s range is less than 60 feet, increase the range to 60 feet.
Any spell DC required is DC 27, and any spell attack roll required is +17. If the rod casts a spell on you, you don’t get a saving throw or other defense against it.
Once activated, the rod can’t be activated again for {@dice 1d4} hours.

D% Wondrous Effect 1–3 Leaves grow from the target; they last 24 hours 4–8 {@spell Darkness|CRB} 9 Summon a giant stag beetle (5th-level summon animal; Pathfinder Bestiary 41) 10–13 A stream of 600 large and colorful butterflies pours forth, fluttering in a 20-foot burst for 2 rounds; creatures are {@condition blinded} while in the cloud of butterflies 14–15 All the target’s weapons animate with the effects of the dancing rune 16–25 {@spell Lightning bolt|CRB} 26–29 Grass grows in a 60-foot cone in front of the rod, or existing grass grows at 10 × normal rate 30 Target turns blue, green, or purple with an unlimited duration 31 Summon an elephant (6th-level {@spell summon animal|CRB}; Pathfinder Bestiary 154) 32–34 Heavy rain falls in a 60-foot radius around you for 1 round 35–38 {@spell Stinking cloud|CRB} 39 Summon an ineffective mouse (1st-level summon animal) 40–42 {@spell Vibrant pattern|CRB}, with a 1-round duration 43–44 The rod casts {@spell mirror image|CRB} on you 45–46 {@spell Gust of wind|CRB} 47–48 The non-living, unattended object closest to the target (up to 30 cubic feet in size) turns ethereal for an unlimited duration 49–53 {@spell Slow|CRB} 54 You turn blue, green, or purple with an unlimited duration 55–59 The rod casts {@spell pest form|CRB} on you, lasting {@dice 1d4} rounds 60–61 {@dice 1d4} × 10 gems, each worth 1 sp, shoot from the rod, dealing 1 piercing damage to each creature in a 15-foot cone 62 {@spell Sleep|CRB}, with a 100-foot burst 63–72 {@spell Fireball|CRB} 73–77 {@spell Mind reading|CRB} 78–80 Roll again; the target believes you created the effect of the second roll 81–84 {@spell Enlarge|CRB} 85–87 Target is coated in nectar, making it {@condition clumsy} 1 for 1 round 88–92 {@spell Faerie fire|CRB} 93–97 The rod casts {@spell invisibility|CRB} on you 98–100 The rod casts {@spell shrink|CRB} on you, lasting 1 day.

item.name: Skeleton Key
entries: A grinning skull tops the bow of this macabre key. This key can be used in place of thieves’ tools when attempting to Pick a {@spell Lock|CRB}, and it grants a +1 item bonus to the Thievery check.
If the skeleton key becomes {@condition broken} due to a critical failure on the check, it works as normal thieves’ tools and loses its benefits until repaired.

entries.trigger: You attempt to Pick a Lock but haven’t rolled yet;
effect: The key casts {@spell knock|CRB} on the {@spell lock|CRB} you’re trying to pick.

entries: The key grants a +2 item bonus, and you can activate the key once per hour.

item.name: Thurible Of Revelation
entries: This brass censer dangles on a length of chain.
Most thuribles of revelation are adorned with swirling Celestial text, though some are iron and feature Infernal or Abyssal text.

effect: You light the incense inside the censer, and it burns for 1 hour. During that time, as long you are holding the thurible, you gain a +1 item bonus to Religion checks, and any critical failure you roll when you Decipher Writing of a religious nature is a failure instead.

entries: The thurible grants a +2 bonus. Once per day, when you activate the thurible, you can increase its revelations. During that activation, you can hold the thurible up to your eyes with an {@action Interact|CRB} action to gain the effects of {@spell see invisibility|CRB} for 1 round by peering through the smoke.

The thurible grants a +3 bonus. The greater version shares the once-per-day enhanced revelations of the moderate version, except peering through the smoke also grants you the effects of {@spell true seeing|CRB}.

item.name: Traveler’s Any-tool
entries: Before it’s activated, this item appears to be an ash rod capped with steel on either end.

effect: You imagine a specific simple tool, and the any-tool transforms into it.

(Usually, you can choose from a tool listed in Chapter 6). This transforms the wooden portion into any haft and the metal caps into spades, hammer heads, or the like, allowing for most basic tools but nothing more complex. You can return the item to its rod form with an {@action Interact|CRB} action.

item.name: Triton’s Conch
entries: If you put this large opalescent conch shell to your ear, you can hear the sound of the roaring sea crashing against the shore.

effect: You can raise the conch to your lips and blow into it, letting out a long, rumbling note. For the next minute, you and all allies who were within 30 feet of you when you activated the conch gain a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks to {@action Swim|CRB} and can breathe under water.

item.name: Wondrous Figurine
entries: Each one of these statuettes is 1 inch in height, carved from a specific material and taking the shape of a particular animal or animals.

effect: You activate the statue by placing it on solid ground and then speaking its name, causing the statuette to transform into a living creature or creatures. In creature form, the figurine has the minion trait. It can understand your language and it obeys you to the best of its ability when you use an action to {@spell command|CRB} it. The specifics of each creature, as well as the activation’s frequency (if any), appear in its entry below.

If the figurine is slain while in {@spell animal form|CRB}, it reverts to its statue shape and cannot be activated again until 1 week has passed. If the figurine is destroyed in statue form, it is shattered and its magic is lost.

entries: This statuette depicts a pair of gold lions, and when activated, it becomes a pair of adult lions (Pathfinder Bestiary 52). The lions can be called on only once per day, and they remain in lion form for no more than 1 hour. If either of the lions is slain, that lion cannot be summoned again until 1 week has passed, but this doesn’t prevent you from summoning the other.

This tiny statue first appears to be a formless lump of jade until closer inspection reveals it to be a serpentine body curled into a snug knot. When activated, this figurine becomes a giant viper (Pathfinder Bestiary 303). The figurine can be used only once per day, and it can remain in serpent form for no more than 10 minutes.

Finely carved from a solid piece of marble, this gleaming elephant statuette becomes a fully grown elephant (Pathfinder Bestiary 154) when activated. The elephant can be called upon no more than four times per month.

It remains for 24 hours as long as it is being used as a beast of burden or for transport. If it attempts an attack or otherwise engages in combat, it reverts to statuette form after {@dice 1d4} rounds.

This sinister-looking black statuette resembles a horse rearing up on its hind legs. When activated, this figurine becomes a {@spell nightmare|CRB} (Pathfinder Bestiary 244). It can be called upon once per week for up to 24 hours, though it won’t use plane shift or its other abilities on behalf of its rider. Although evil, it allows itself to be ridden by creatures of any alignment, although if a good creature mounts it, the rider must attempt a DC 3 flat check. On a failure, the {@spell nightmare|CRB} uses {@spell plane shift|CRB} to take the rider to a random location in the Abyss, where it promptly returns to statue form, stranding its rider in that nightmarish place.
This simple onyx statue transforms into a guard dog (Pathfinder Bestiary 102). The dog has a +4 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to {@action Track|CRB}, and it has {@spell darkvision|CRB}.

When the dog senses a {@condition hidden} creature with its scent, that creature is instead {@condition observed} and {@condition concealed}. The onyx dog can be activated once per week and remains in its form for up to 6 hours.

item.name: Adamantine
entries: Mined from rocks that fell from the heavens, adamantine is one of the hardest metals known. It has a shiny, black appearance, and it is prized for its amazing resiliency and ability to hold an incredibly sharp edge.
Adamantine Items Hardness HP BT Thin Items Standard-grade 10 40 20 High-grade 13 52 26.

item.name: Cold Iron
entries: Weapons made from cold iron are deadly to demons and fey alike.
Cold iron looks like normal iron but is mined from particularly pure sources and shaped with little or no heat. This process is extremely difficult, especially for high-grade cold iron items.
Cold Iron Items Hardness HP BT Thin Items Low-grade 5 20 10 Standard-grade 7 28 14 High-grade 10 40 20.

item.name: Darkwood
entries: Darkwood is a very lightweight wood found primarily in oldgrowth forests in south-central Avistan; it is dark as ebony but has a slight purple tint. A darkwood item’s Bulk is reduced by 1 (or to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on an item that normally has light Bulk). The Price of an item made of darkwood is based on the item’s normal Bulk, not its reduced Bulk for being made of darkwood, but reduce the Bulk before making any further Bulk adjustments for the size of the item.
Darkwood Items Hardness HP BT Thin Items Standard-grade 5 20 10 High-grade 8 32 16.

item.name: Dragonhide
entries: The hide and scales of a dragon can be used to {@action Craft|CRB} any item normally made of ordinary leather or hide. Dragonhide varies in color from blue to glittering gold, depending on the dragon it came from. Due to the scales’ resiliency, it can also be used to {@action Craft|CRB} armor usually made out of metal plates (such as a breastplate, half plate, and full plate), allowing such armor to be made without metal. Dragonhide objects are immune to one damage type, depending on the type of dragon (see the table below).
Dragon.

item.name: Mithral
entries: Mithral is renowned for its lightness, durability, and effectiveness against a range of creatures including devils and lycanthropes. It has the same sheen as silver but a slightly lighter hue. Mithral weapons and armor are treated as if they were silver for the purpose of damaging creatures with weakness to silver. A metal item made of mithral is lighter than one made of iron or steel: the item’s Bulk is reduced by 1 (reduced to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on an item that normally has light Bulk). The Price of an item made of this material is based on the item’s normal Bulk, not its reduced Bulk for being made of mithral, but reduce the Bulk before making any further Bulk adjustments for the size of the item.
Mithral Items Hardness HP BT Thin Items Standard-grade 5 20 10 High-grade 8 32 16.

item.name: Orichalcum
entries: The most rare and valuable skymetal, orichalcum is coveted for its incredible time-related magical properties. This dull, coppery metal isn’t as physically sturdy as adamantine, but orichalcum’s time-bending properties protect it, granting it greater Hardness and Hit Points. If an orichalcum item takes damage but isn’t destroyed, it repairs itself completely 24 hours later.
Orichalcum Items Hardness HP BT Thin Items High-grade 16 64 32.

item.name: Silver
entries: Silver weapons are a {@spell bane|CRB} to creatures ranging from devils to werewolves. Silver items are less durable than steel items, and low-grade silver items are usually merely silver-plated.
Silver Items Hardness HP BT Thin Items Low-grade 3 12 6 Standard-grade 5 20 10 High-grade 8 32 16.

item.name: Armor Potency
entries: Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor’s item bonus to AC by 1. The armor can be etched with one property rune.

You can upgrade the armor potency rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.

variants.craft_requirements: You are an expert in Crafting.
You are a master in Crafting. Increase the armor’s item bonus to AC by 2, and the armor can be etched with two property runes.
You are legendary in Crafting. Increase the armor’s item bonus to AC by 3, and the armor can be etched with three property runes.

item.name: Resilient
entries: Resilient runes imbue armor with additional protective magic.
This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

You can upgrade the resilient rune already etched on a suit of armor to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.
The armor grants a +2 item bonus to saving throws.
The armor grants a +3 item bonus to saving throws.
Fundamental Weapon Runes.

item.name: Striking
entries: A striking rune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a +1 striking dagger would deal {@dice 2d4} damage instead of {@dice 1d4} damage.

You can upgrade the striking rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.
The weapon deals three weapon damage dice.
The weapon deals four weapon damage dice.

item.name: Weapon Potency
entries: Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.

You can upgrade the weapon potency rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes’ Prices.

variants.craft_requirements: You are an expert in Crafting.
You are a master in Crafting. The item bonus to attack rolls is +2, and the weapon can be etched with two property runes.

You are legendary in Crafting. The item bonus to attack rolls is +3, and the weapon can be etched with three property runes. UPGRADING ARMOR AND WEAPON RUNES You’ll often want to upgrade the fundamental runes of magic armor or a {@spell magic weapon|CRB} you already have. This requires upgrading each rune separately. Tables 11–5 and 11–6 summarize the Price of each step, with a number in parentheses indicating the item’s level for the {@action Craft|CRB} activity. This also indicates the typical progression for an adventurer to follow when upgrading their armor and weapons. The tables here don’t include progressions that aren’t as likely to come up, like turning a +1 weapon directly into a +1 greater striking weapon. TABLE 11–5: ARMOR UPGRADE PRICES Starting Armor Improved Armor Price and Process +1 armor +1 resilient armor 340 gp to etch resilient (8th level) +1 resilient armor +2 resilient armor 900 gp to etch +2 armor potency (11th level) +2 resilient armor +2 greater resilient armor 3,100 gp to etch greater resilient (14th level) +2 greater resilient armor +3 greater resilient armor 19,500 gp to etch +3 armor potency (18th level) +3 greater resilient armor +3 major resilient armor 46,000 gp to etch major resilient (20th level) TABLE 11–6: WEAPON UPGRADE PRICES Starting Weapon Improved Weapon Price and Process +1 weapon +1 striking weapon 65 gp to etch striking (4th level) +1 striking weapon +2 striking weapon 900 gp to etch +2 weapon potency (10th level) +2 striking weapon +2 greater striking weapon 1,000 gp to etch greater striking (12th level) +2 greater striking weapon +3 greater striking weapon 8,000 gp to etch +3 weapon potency (16th level) +3 greater striking weapon +3 major striking weapon 30,000 gp to etch major striking (19th level) Property Runes Property runes add special abilities to armor or a weapon in addition to the item’s fundamental runes. If a suit of armor or a weapon has multiple etchings of the same rune, only the highest-level one applies. You can upgrade a property rune to a higher-level type of that rune in the same way you would upgrade a fundamental rune. Rune abilities that must be activated follow the rules for activating magic items on page 532.

item.name: Antimagic
entries: This intricate rune displaces spell energy, granting you a +1 status bonus to saving throws against magical effects.

entries.trigger: A spell targets you or includes you in its area;
effect: The armor attempts to counteract the triggering spell with the effect of a 7th-level {@spell dispel magic|CRB} spell and a counteract modifier of +26.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell dispel magic|CRB}.

item.name: Energy-resistant
entries: These symbols convey protective forces from the Elemental Planes. You gain resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, or fire.
The crafter chooses the damage type when creating the rune.

Multiple energy-resistant runes can be etched onto a suit of armor; rather than using only the highest-level effect, each must provide resistance to a different damage type. For instance, a +2 acid-resistant greater fire-resistant breastplate would give you acid resistance 5 and fire resistance 10.
You gain resistance 10 to the specified damage type.

item.name: Ethereal
entries: An ethereal rune replicates armor on the Ethereal Plane.

effect: You gain the effects of an {@spell ethereal jaunt|CRB} spell. This doesn’t require concentration and lasts for 10 minutes or until you choose to return to material form as a free action.

item.craft_requirements: Supply a casting of 9th level {@spell ethereal jaunt|CRB}.

item.name: Fortification
item.usage: etched onto medium or heavy armor
entries: A fortification rune wards against the most deadly attacks.

Each time you’re critically hit while wearing the etched armor, attempt a DC 17 flat check. On a success, it becomes a normal hit. This property thickens the armor, increasing its Bulk by 1 and the Strength required to reduce its penalties by 2.
The flat check DC is 14.

item.name: Glamered
entries: This armor can be disguised with a mere thought.

effect: You change the shape and appearance of this armor to appear as ordinary or fine clothes of your imagining. The armor’s statistics do not change. Only a creature that is benefiting from {@spell true seeing|CRB} or a similar effect can attempt to disbelieve this illusion, with a DC of 25.

item.name: Invisibility
entries: Light seems to partially penetrate this armor.

effect: Whispering the {@spell command|CRB} word, you become {@condition invisible} for 1 minute, gaining the effects of a 2nd-level {@spell invisibility|CRB} spell.

variants.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell invisibility|CRB}.
entries: You can activate the armor up to three times per day.

item.name: Shadow
item.usage: etched onto light or medium nonmetallic armor
entries: Armor with this rune becomes hazy black. You gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks while wearing the armor.
The item bonus is +2.
The item bonus is +3.

item.name: Slick
entries: This property makes armor slippery, as though it were coated with a thin film of oil. You gain a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks to {@action Escape|CRB} and {@action Squeeze|CRB}.
The item bonus is +2.
The item bonus is +3.
Weapon Property Runes.

item.name: Anarchic
item.usage: etched onto a weapon without an axiomatic rune
entries: An anarchic rune is jagged and asymmetrical, channeling chaotic energy. A weapon with this rune deals an additional {@dice 1d6} chaotic damage against lawful targets. If you are lawful, you are {@condition enfeebled} 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

When you critically succeed at a {@action Strike|CRB} with this weapon against a lawful creature, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 1 or 2, you deal double minimum damage; on a 3 or 4, double your damage normally; on a 5 or 6, you deal double maximum damage.
item.craft_requirements: You are chaotic.

item.name: Axiomatic
item.usage: etched onto a weapon without an anarchic rune
entries: Complex and symmetrical, an axiomatic rune imbues a weapon with lawful energy. A weapon with this rune deals an additional {@dice 1d6} lawful damage against chaotic targets. If you are chaotic, you are {@condition enfeebled} 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

When you critically succeed at an attack roll with this weapon against a chaotic creature, instead of rolling, count each weapon damage die as average damage rounded up (3 for d4, 4 for d6, 5 for d8, 6 for d10, 7 for d12).
item.craft_requirements: You are lawful.

item.name: Corrosive
entries: Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon. When you hit with the weapon, add {@dice 1d6} acid damage to the damage dealt.
In addition, on a critical hit, the target’s armor (if any) takes {@dice 3d6} acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.
The acid damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s acid resistance. Increase the acid damage dealt to armor or a shield on a critical hit to {@dice 6d6}.

item.name: Dancing
entries: A dancing weapon flies autonomously and strikes your foes.

effect: You {@action Release|CRB} the weapon and it dances through the air, fighting on its own against the last enemy you attacked, or the nearest enemy to it if your target has been defeated. At the end of your turn each round, the weapon can {@action Fly|CRB} up to its fly Speed of 40 feet, and then can either {@action Fly|CRB} again or {@action Strike|CRB} one creature within its reach.

The weapon has a space of 5 feet, but it doesn’t block or impede enemies attempting to move though that space, nor does it benefit from or provide flanking. The weapon can’t move through an enemy’s space. The weapon can’t use reactions, and its {@action Fly|CRB} actions don’t trigger reactions.
While it’s activated, a dancing weapon makes Strikes with an attack modifier of +24 plus its item bonus to attack rolls. It uses the weapon’s normal damage but has a +0 Strength modifier.
The weapon’s abilities that automatically trigger on a hit or critical hit still function, but the weapon can’t be activated or benefit from any of your abilities while dancing.

Each round, when the weapon is finished using its actions, attempt a DC 6 flat check. On a failure, the activation ends and the weapon falls to the ground. You can’t activate the item again for 10 minutes.

item.name: Disrupting
entries: A disrupting weapon pulses with positive energy, dealing an extra {@dice 1d6} positive damage to undead. On a critical hit, the undead is also {@condition enfeebled} 1 until the end of your next turn.

Increase the extra damage to {@dice 2d6}. On a critical hit, instead of being {@condition enfeebled} 1, the undead creature must attempt a DC 34 Fortitude save with the following effects. This is an incapacitation effect.

entries.Critical Success: It’s {@condition enfeebled} 1 until the end of your next turn.
entries.Success: It’s {@condition enfeebled} 2 until the end of your next turn.
entries.Failure: It’s {@condition enfeebled} 3 until the end of your next turn.

item.name: Flaming
entries: This weapon is empowered by flickering flame. The weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d6} fire damage on a successful {@action Strike|CRB}, plus {@dice 1d10} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage} on a critical hit.

Increase the {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage} on a critical hit to {@dice 2d10}. Fire damage dealt by this weapon (including the {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent fire damage}) ignores the target’s fire resistance.

item.name: Frost
entries: This weapon is empowered with freezing ice. It deals an additional {@dice 1d6} cold damage on a successful {@action Strike|CRB}. On a critical hit, the target is also {@condition slowed} 1 until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a DC 24 Fortitude save.
The save DC is 34. Cold damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s cold resistance.

item.name: Ghost Touch
entries: The weapon can {@spell harm|CRB} creatures without physical form. A ghost touch weapon is particularly effective against incorporeal creatures, which almost always have a specific weakness to ghost touch weapons. Incorporeal creatures can touch, hold, and wield ghost touch weapons (unlike most physical objects).

item.name: Grievous
entries: When your attack roll with this weapon is a critical hit and gains the critical specialization effect, you gain an additional benefit depending on the weapon group.
Axe You can damage a third creature, with the same restrictions.
Bow The Athletics check to pull the missile free is DC 20.
Brawling The target takes a –4 circumstance penalty to its save.
Club You can {@spell knock|CRB} the target up to 15 feet away.
Dart The base {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} increases to {@dice 2d6}.
Flail You move the target 5 feet. You can’t move it away from you, but you can move it in another direction of your choice.
Hammer You can also {@spell knock|CRB} the target 5 feet away from you.
Knife The target takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speed while it has the {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}.
Pick The extra damage from the critical specialization effect increases to 4 per weapon damage die.
Polearm You can move the target up to 10 feet.
Shield You can {@spell knock|CRB} the target up to 10 feet away.
Sling The target also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 round if it fails the save.
Spear The {@condition enfeebled} condition lasts for 2 rounds.
Sword The target is {@condition flat-footed} until the end of your next turn.

item.name: Holy
item.usage: etched onto a weapon without an unholy rune
entries: Holy weapons {@spell command|CRB} powerful celestial energy. A weapon with this rune deals an extra {@dice 1d6} good damage against evil targets. If you are evil, you are {@condition enfeebled} 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

effect: You regain HP equal to double the evil creature’s level. This is a good, positive, healing effect.

item.craft_requirements: You are good.

item.name: Keen
item.usage: etched onto a piercing or slashing melee weapon
entries: The edges of a keen weapon are preternaturally sharp. Attacks with this weapon are a critical hit on a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success. This property has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.

item.name: Returning
entries: When you make a thrown {@action Strike|CRB} with this weapon, it flies back to your hand after the {@action Strike|CRB} is complete. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

item.name: Shifting
entries: With a moment of manipulation, you can shift this weapon into a different weapon with a similar form.

effect: The weapon takes the shape of another melee weapon that requires the same number of hands to wield. The weapon’s runes and any precious material it’s made of apply to the weapon’s new shape. Any property runes that can’t apply to the new form are suppressed until the item takes a shape to which they can apply.

item.name: Shock
entries: Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra {@dice 1d6} electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.
Electricity damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s electricity resistance (and the other creatures’ on a critical hit).

item.name: Speed
entries: Attacks with a speed weapon are supernaturally swift. While wielding a speed weapon, you gain the {@condition quickened} condition, but you can use the additional action granted only to make a {@action Strike|CRB} with the etched weapon.

item.name: Spell-storing
entries: A spell-storing rune creates a reservoir of eldritch energy within the etched weapon. A spellcaster can spend 1 minute to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower into the weapon. The spell must have a casting of 2 actions or fewer and must be able to target a creature other than the caster. The spell has no immediate effect—it is instead stored for later. When you wield a spell-storing weapon, you immediately know the name and level of the stored spell. A spell-storing weapon found as treasure has a 50% chance of having a spell of the GM’s choice stored in it.

entries.requirements: On your previous action this turn, you hit and damaged a creature with this weapon;
effect: You unleash the stored spell, which uses the target of the triggering attack as the target of the spell. This empties the spell from the weapon and allows a spell to be cast into it again.
If the spell requires a spell attack roll, the result of your attack roll with the weapon determines the degree of success of the spell, and if the spell requires a saving throw, the DC is 30.
Harmlessly expend the stored spell. This frees the weapon to have a new spell cast into it.

item.name: Thundering
entries: This weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra {@dice 1d6} sonic damage on a successful {@action Strike|CRB}. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).
The save DC is 34, and the {@spell deafness|CRB} is permanent. Sonic damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target’s sonic resistance.

item.name: Unholy
item.usage: etched onto a weapon without a holy rune
entries: An unholy rune instills fiendish power into the etched weapon.
A weapon with this rune deals an additional {@dice 1d6} evil damage when it hits a good target. If you are good, you are {@condition enfeebled} 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

entries.trigger: You critically succeed at an attack roll against a good creature with the weapon;
effect: The target takes {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage} equal to {@dice 1d8} per weapon damage die of the etched weapon.

item.craft_requirements: You are evil.

item.name: Vorpal
item.usage: etched onto a slashing melee weapon
entries: Originally created as a means of slaying the legendary jabberwock, vorpal weapons prove equally effective against nearly any foe with a head.

entries.trigger: You roll a natural 20 on a Strike with the weapon, critically succeed, and deal slashing damage.
effect: The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude save or be decapitated. This kills any creature except ones that don’t require a head to live. For creatures with multiple heads, this usually kills the creature only if you sever its last head.

item.name: Wounding
item.usage: etched onto a piercing or slashing melee weapon
entries: Weapons with wounding runes are said to thirst for blood.

When you hit a creature with a wounding weapon, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}. On a critical hit, it instead deals {@dice 1d12} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}.

item.name: Adamantine Shield
entries: Adamantine shields are particularly sturdy, and when used for a shield bash, they are adamantine weapons.

variants.craft_requirements: adamantine worth at least 50 gp The shield has Hardness 8, HP 32, and BT 16.
adamantine worth at least 55 gp The shield has Hardness 10, HP 40, and BT 20.

entries: gp; Bulk L; {@action Craft|CRB} Requirements adamantine worth at least4,000 gp The shield has Hardness 11, HP 44, and BT 22.

variants.craft_requirements: adamantine worth at least 4,400 gp The shield has Hardness 13, HP 52, and BT 26.

item.name: Cold Iron Shield
entries: Cold iron shields don’t typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are cold iron weapons.
{@action Craft|CRB} Bulk L; Requirements cold iron worth at least 15 sp The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, and BT 6.
{@action Craft|CRB} Bulk 1; Requirements cold iron worth at least 17 sp The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

variants.craft_requirements: cold iron worth at least 375 sp The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.
cold iron worth at least 425 sp The shield has Hardness 7, HP 28, and BT 14.
cold iron worth at least 2,500 gp The shield has Hardness 8, HP 32, and BT 16.
cold iron worth at least 2,750 gp The shield has Hardness 10, HP 40, and BT 20.

item.name: Darkwood Shield
entries: Darkwood shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk).

variants.craft_requirements: darkwood worth at least 50 gp The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, and BT 6.
darkwood worth at least 55 gp The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

entries: gp; Bulk 3; {@action Craft|CRB} Requirements darkwood worth at least 70 gpThe shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.

variants.craft_requirements: darkwood worth at least 4,000 gp The shield has Hardness 6, HP 24, and BT 12.
darkwood worth at least 4,400 gp The shield has Hardness 8, HP 32, and BT 16.
darkwood worth at least 5,600 gp The shield has Hardness 8, HP 32, and BT 16.

item.name: Dragonhide Shield
entries: Dragonhide shields are each immune to one damage type based on the type of dragon (see Dragonhide on page 579).

variants.craft_requirements: dragonhide worth at least 50 gp The shield has Hardness 2, HP 8, and BT 4.
dragonhide worth at least 55 gp The shield has Hardness 4, HP 16, and BT 8.
dragonhide worth at least 4,000 gp The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.
dragonhide worth at least 4,400 gp The shield has Hardness 7, HP 28, and BT 14.

item.name: Mithral Shield
entries: Mithral shields are 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if their normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a shield that normally has light Bulk). When used for a shield bash, they are treated as silver weapons.

variants.craft_requirements: mithral worth at least 50 gp The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, and BT 6.
mithral worth at least 55 gp The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, BT 10.
mithral worth at least 4,000 gp The shield has Hardness 6, HP 24, and BT 12.

entries: {@action Craft|CRB} Bulk 1; Requirements at least 4,400 gp of mithral The shield has Hardness 8, HP 32, and BT 16.

item.name: Orichalcum Shield
entries: Orichalcum shields’ time-bending properties are particularly useful for keeping them intact. The first time each day an orichalcum shield would be destroyed, it is instead left with 1 Hit Point and the {@condition broken} condition.

variants.craft_requirements: orichalcum worth at least 6,000 gp The shield has Hardness 14, HP 56, and BT 28.

entries: gp; Bulk 1; {@action Craft|CRB} Requirements orichalcum worth at least6,600 gp The shield has Hardness 16, HP 64, and BT 32.

item.name: Silver Shield
entries: Silver shields don’t typically have an additional effect, though when used for a shield bash, they are silver weapons.

variants.craft_requirements: silver worth at least 15 sp The shield has Hardness 1, HP 4, and BT 2.
silver worth at least 17 sp The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, and BT 6.
silver worth at least 375 sp The shield has Hardness 3, HP 12, BT 6.
silver worth at least 425 sp The shield has Hardness 5, HP 20, and BT 10.
silver worth at least 2,500 gp The shield has Hardness 6, HP 24, and BT 12.
silver worth at least 2,750 gp The shield has Hardness 8 HP 32, and BT 16.

item.name: Arrow-catching Shield
entries: This wooden shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) is carved with images of overlapping fletched arrows.

entries.trigger: A ranged weapon Strike targets a creature within 15 feet of you when you have this shield raised, and the attacker has not yet rolled their attack;
effect: The triggering {@action Strike|CRB} targets you instead of its normal target.
If it hits, you gain the effects of the Shield Block reaction.

item.name: Dragonslayer’s Shield
entries: A dragonslayer’s shield is a steel shield covered with dragonhide from a certain type of dragon, which distinguishes each shield from the others. While raised, this steel shield (Hardness 8, HP 32, BT 16) grants its circumstance bonus to Reflex saves against area effects (as well as to AC, as normal)

While you hold the shield, it also grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Will saves against a dragon’s frightful presence ability. The shield has resistance 10 against the damage type corresponding to the type of dragon whose hide was used in its {@spell creation|CRB} (see dragonhide on page 579); this applies after reducing the damage for Hardness, so when you use Shield Block, the dragonslayer’s shield takes 18 less damage from attacks of that damage type. You can use Shield Block against attacks that deal damage of that type.
item.craft_requirements: The initial raw materials must include at least 30 gp of dragonhide.

item.name: Floating Shield
entries: A floating shield is usually carved with wing motifs. This buckler (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) can protect you on its own.

effect: The shield magically releases itself and floats off your arm into the air next to you, granting you its bonus automatically, as if you had Raised the Shield. Because you’re not wielding the shield, you can’t use reactions such as Shield Block with the shield, but you gain its benefits even when using both of your hands. After 1 minute, the shield drops to the ground, ending its floating effect. While the shield is adjacent to you, you can {@action Interact|CRB} to grasp it, ending its floating effect early.

entries: You can activate the shield any number of times per day.

item.name: Force Shield
entries: The edges of this elaborately engraved steel shield (Hardness 8, HP 32, BT 16) bear tiny glass tiles set in mosaic patterns.

effect: The shield surrounds you with a bubble of force that protects you from {@spell harm|CRB}, granting you resistance 5 to physical damage for 1 minute. The bubble disappears if you cease holding the shield.

item.name: Forge Warden
entries: The religious symbol of Torag, the forge god—an ornate hammer of dwarven construction—adorns the face of this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12). The shield is a religious symbol of Torag.

You and any adjacent allies have fire resistance 5 while you have the shield raised. When used for a Shield Block, the forge warden rings out like the hammer strike of a blacksmith, and the symbol glows as if lit by the fires of a furnace.

entries.trigger: You use the forge warden to Shield Block an adjacent creature’s attack and the shield takes damage;
effect: The attacking creature takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage.

item.name: Indestructible Shield
entries: An indestructible shield is a high-grade adamantine shield (Hardness 13, HP 90) that can withstand just about any damage. It can be damaged only by a {@spell disintegrate|CRB} spell (roll damage as if against a creature that failed its save) or by an artifact tied to destruction, such as a sphere of annihilation.
item.craft_requirements: The raw materials must include at least 4,400 gp of adamantine.

item.name: Lion’s Shield
entries: This steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 36, BT 18) is forged into the shape of a roaring lion’s head.
The lion’s head functions as +1 striking shield boss that can’t be removed from the shield.

effect: You animate the lion’s head. You Raise the Shield and make a melee {@action Strike|CRB} with it as part of the same action. The shield’s biting maw is a martial melee weapon that deals {@dice 2d6} piercing damage and has the deadly {@dice 1d6} trait; it can’t be enhanced by runes. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, during which time you can {@action Strike|CRB} with it each time you Raise the Shield, as well as with a {@action Strike|CRB} action.

item.name: Reflecting Shield
entries: This high-grade silver buckler (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) is polished to a mirrorlike sheen. The shield functions as a spellguard shield (see below) that can also reflect spells.

effect: You attempt to reflect the spell on its caster, with the effects of a 9th-level {@spell spell turning|CRB} with a counteract modifier of +40.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of {@spell spell turning|CRB}, and the initial raw materials must include at least 2,750 gp of silver.

item.name: Spellguard Shield
entries: This shield bears eldritch glyphs to guard against magic. While you have this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12) raised, you gain its circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells that target you (as well as to AC).

item.name: Spined Shield
entries: Five jagged spines project from the surface of this steel shield (Hardness 6, HP 24, BT 12). The spines are +1 striking shield spikes. When you use the Shield Block reaction with this shield, the spines take the damage before the shield itself does. When the shield would take damage (after applying Hardness), one spine snaps off per 6 damage, reducing the damage by 6. The shield takes any remaining damage. When there are no spines left, the shield takes damage as normal.
When all the spines are gone, you lose the ability to attack with them until the spines {@spell regenerate|CRB} the next day.

effect: You shoot one of the shield’s spines at a target. A fired spine uses the spikes’ statistics, but it is a martial ranged weapon with a range increment of 120 feet.

item.name: Sturdy Shield
entries: With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.
The shield has Hardness 8, HP 64, and BT 32.
The shield has Hardness 10, HP 80, and BT 40.
The shield has Hardness 13, HP 104, and BT 52.
The shield has Hardness 15, HP 120, and BT 60.
The shield has Hardness 17, HP 136, and BT 68.
The shield has Hardness 20, HP 160, and BT 80.

item.name: Alarm Snare
entries: You create an {@spell alarm|CRB} snare by rigging one or more noisy objects to a trip wire or pressure plate. When you create an {@spell alarm|CRB} snare, you designate a range between 100 to 500 feet at which it can be heard. When a Small or larger creature enters the square, the snare makes a noise loud enough that it can be heard by all creatures in the range you designated.

item.name: Biting Snare
entries: The snare’s jaws shut on the leg of a creature that steps on it. The snare deals {@dice 5d6} piercing damage to the first creature that enters its square; that creature must attempt a DC 18 Reflex save.

entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage and takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed until it recovers at least 1 Hit Point.

item.name: Bleeding Spines Snare
entries: When a creature enters the square, spines covered in numerous jagged thorns protrude out to stab it, dealing {@dice 8d8} piercing damage and {@dice 2d8} {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent bleed damage}. The creature must attempt a DC 31 basic Reflex saving throw. After the initial trigger, the spines retract and protrude again repeatedly for 1 minute, forcing any creature that enters the space or ends its turn in the space to attempt a Reflex save against the spines’ damage.

item.name: Bomb Snare
entries: You create a snare that catalyzes three 3rd-level moderate alchemical bombs of the same type to explode when a creature enters the snare’s square. The target and all creatures in adjacent squares must attempt a DC 26 Reflex save, as the snare deals damage equal to three times the direct hit damage from one of the component bombs (for example, {@dice 6d6} electricity damage from bottled lightning) with no splash damage or other effects.

entries.Success: The creature takes half damage and no other effects.
entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage. It also takes all other effects of a direct hit from one of the component bombs (such as {@condition flat-footed} from bottled lightning or {@condition Persistent Damage|CRB|persistent damage} from an acid flask).
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage, plus all other effects of a direct hit (as failure).

item.craft_requirements: Supply six of the same damaging 3rd-level moderate alchemical bomb.

item.name: Caltrop Snare
entries: This snare consists of a {@condition hidden} canister of caltrops (page 287) attached to a trip wire. When the snare is triggered, it flings the caltrops into either the snare’s square or a square adjacent to the snare. You choose which square when you set up the snare.
If the caltrops scatter into the same square as a creature, that creature must attempt the Acrobatics check immediately.
item.craft_requirements: Supply a container of caltrops.

item.name: Flying Blade Wheel Snare
entries: When a creature enters the square, a deadly flying wheel of spinning blades launches at it, making a {@action Strike|CRB} with an attack modifier of +33 and dealing {@dice 8d8} slashing damage. Once on each of your turns, you can use an {@action Interact|CRB} action within 120 feet of the wheel to cause it to {@action Fly|CRB} up to 60 feet toward the creature it’s chasing and make another {@action Strike|CRB} if it’s within 5 feet of its target after it moves. After 1 minute, the spinning ceases and the wheel falls to the ground. Creatures can destroy the wheel to stop it (AC 37, Fort +29, Ref +20, HP 200, Hardness 10, object immunities).

item.name: Grasping Snare
entries: You rig vines and ropes to hold a creature in place. The first creature to enter the square must attempt a DC 26 Reflex save, with the following effects.

entries.Success: The creature takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 minute or until it Escapes (DC 26).
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition immobilized} for 1 round, then takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 minute. Both effects end early if it Escapes (DC 26)
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition immobilized} for 1 minute or until it Escapes (DC 26).

item.name: Hail Of Arrows Snare
entries: When a creature enters the snare’s square, it releases hundreds upon hundreds of carefully prepared arrows, blanketing a 20-foot radius around the snare’s square with massive arrow fire that deals {@dice 18d6} piercing damage. Creatures in the area must attempt a DC 37 basic Reflex saving throw.

item.name: Hampering Snare
entries: You arrange brambles, wires, sticky goo, or other materials to interfere with a creature’s movement. The square with this snare, as well as three adjacent squares (to form a 10-foot-by-10-foot area), become difficult terrain when the first creature enters the snare’s square. The difficult terrain affects the creature’s movement right away, including its movement into the triggering square, and it lasts for {@dice 1d4} rounds after the snare is triggered. A creature can use an {@action Interact|CRB} action to clear the difficult terrain out of a single square early.

item.name: Hobbling Snare
entries: You rig vines, ropes, or wires to cinch tight around a creature that triggers this snare. The first creature to enter the square must attempt a DC 20 Reflex save.

entries.Success: The creature takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 minute or until it Escapes (DC 18).
entries.Failure: As success, but the penalty is –10 feet.
entries.Critical Failure: As success, but the penalty is –20 feet.

item.name: Instant Evisceration Snare
entries: When a creature enters the snare’s square, the snare releases an unbelievable arsenal of blades, dealing {@dice 24d8} piercing damage (DC 45 basic Reflex).

item.name: Marking Snare
entries: This snare is often used to mark intruders for later tracking or identification. When you create this snare, you must decide whether to make it a dye or a scent marker. Either type of marking grants a +2 circumstance bonus to {@action Track|CRB} the creature for up to 24 hours or until the dye or scent is washed off (requiring at least a gallon of water and 10 minutes of scrubbing). A creature that enters a square of the snare must attempt a DC 17 Reflex save.

entries.Critical Failure: The snare marks the creature, and the creature is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Omnidirectional Spear Snare
entries: As soon as a creature enters the snare’s square, the snare unleashes wickedly powerful spears at the creature from all directions, dealing {@dice 19d8} piercing damage (DC 37 basic Reflex).

item.name: Scything Blade Snare
entries: This snare sends a powerful series of scything blades to slice through a creature entering the snare’s square, dealing {@dice 14d8} slashing damage (DC 31 basic Reflex).

item.name: Signaling Snare
entries: A subtle snare used in hunting or tracking, a signaling snare often consists of carefully prepared earth, piled sand or stones, specific arrangements of vegetation, and so forth.

When a creature enters a square of a signaling snare, nothing happens to the creature, but instead it causes a small, unobtrusive disruption to the terrain that allows the snare’s creator or another creature who knows what to look for to determine whether a creature of the appropriate size entered the square.

item.name: Spike Snare
entries: This basic snare consists of {@condition hidden} spikes that rely on a creature’s momentum to lacerate or potentially impale it as it enters the snare’s square, dealing {@dice 2d8} piercing damage. The creature must attempt a DC 17 basic Reflex saving throw.

item.name: Stalker Bane Snare
entries: This snare explodes in a burst of cloying powder that can cling to a creature stepping into its square. A creature that enters the square of a stalker {@spell bane|CRB} snare must attempt a DC 20 Reflex save.

entries.Success: Powder sticks to the target, causing it to leave behind telltale footprints. Being {@condition invisible} makes the target {@condition hidden}, rather than {@condition undetected}, to creatures that could see it if it weren’t {@condition invisible}.
entries.Failure: Powder clumps on the target, constantly flaking away. Being {@condition invisible} makes the target {@condition concealed}, rather than {@condition hidden} or {@condition undetected}, to creatures that could see it if it weren’t {@condition invisible}.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, and the creature is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Striking Snare
entries: You affix a trip line or other trigger to a group of either stones or wooden stakes to strike a creature that enters the snare’s square. The creature must attempt a DC 26 basic Reflex saving throw. If you choose stones, the snare deals {@dice 9d8} bludgeoning damage; if you choose spikes, it deals {@dice 9d8} piercing damage.

item.name: Stunning Snare
entries: You rig a snare to disorient a creature with a quick bash, leaving it with little ability to defend itself. The trap deals {@dice 6d6} bludgeoning damage to the first creature to enter its square; that creature must attempt a DC 31 Reflex save.

entries.Success: The creature takes half damage and is {@condition flat-footed} for 1 round and {@condition stunned} 1.
entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition flat-footed} for 1 round and {@condition stunned} 2.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage and is {@condition flat-footed} for 1 minute and {@condition stunned} 4.

item.name: Trip Snare
entries: You set a cunning wire to trip a creature. A Medium or smaller creature that enters this snare’s square must attempt a DC 20 Reflex save.

If you want to create a trip snare to trip a larger creature, you must create a group of contiguous snares of a length equal to the edge of that larger creature’s space, and the creature must be moving such that it moves into the full set of snares.
For example, three trip snares in a 15-foot-line can trip a Huge creature coming down a corridor into the line of snares.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition flat-footed} until the start of its next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature falls {@condition prone} and takes {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Warning Snare
entries: Using materials specific to the area, you connect a sound‑making component to a trip wire or a pressure plate.

This snare is like an {@spell alarm|CRB} snare, but its subtle sound blends into ambient noise. You can detect this sound as long as you’re within 1,000 feet of the snare and aren’t prevented from hearing it. Other creatures in that area who are searching might notice the sound if their Perception check result meets or exceeds your {@action Craft|CRB} DC.

item.name: Animal Staff
entries: This staff is topped with carved animal and monster heads.
While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to identify animals.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

items: {@bold 2nd} {@spell animal messenger|CRB}, {@spell speak with animals|CRB}, {@spell summon animal|CRB}
{@bold 5th} {@spell animal form|CRB}, {@spell moon frenzy|CRB}, {@spell summon animal|CRB}

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Mentalist’s Staff
entries: This polished wooden staff bears a swirling motif reminiscent of the folds of a brain. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify mental magic.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Abjuration
entries: This intricately carved wooden staff is warm to the touch and thrums with inner energy. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify abjuration magic.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

items: {@bold 2nd} {@spell dispel magic|CRB}, {@spell endure elements|CRB}, {@spell resist energy|CRB}
{@bold 4th} {@spell dimensional anchor|CRB}, {@spell dispel magic|CRB}, {@spell resist energy|CRB}

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Conjuration
entries: This ash staff is decorated with animals; wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify conjuration magic.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

items: {@bold 2nd} {@spell obscuring mist|CRB}, {@spell phantom steed|CRB}, {@spell summon construct|CRB}, {@spell summon elemental|CRB}
{@bold 3rd} {@spell stinking cloud|CRB}, {@spell summon construct|CRB}, {@spell summon elemental|CRB}
{@bold 4th} {@spell creation|CRB}, {@spell phantom steed|CRB}, {@spell summon construct|CRB}, {@spell summon elemental|CRB}
{@bold 5th} {@spell black tentacles|CRB}, {@spell summon construct|CRB}, summon elemental
{@bold 6th} {@spell phantom steed|CRB}, {@spell summon construct|CRB}, summon elemental

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Divination
entries: Semiprecious gemstones emerge, seemingly at random, from the surface of this gnarled wooden staff. While wielding it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify divination magic.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Enchantment
entries: A mesmerizing gemstone caps the head of this handsomely crafted wooden staff. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify enchantment magic.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Evocation
entries: This staff is tapered at the base and carved into a gemstudded twist at the top. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify evocation magic.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Fire
entries: This staff resembles a blackened and burned length of ashen wood. It smells faintly of soot and glows as if lit by embers.
You can use an {@action Interact|CRB} action to touch the tip of this staff to a torch, tinder, or a flammable substance to ignite a flame.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

items: {@bold 4th} {@spell fire shield|CRB}, {@spell fireball|CRB}, {@spell wall of fire|CRB}

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Healing
entries: Made of smooth, white wood, this staff is capped at each end with a golden cross adorned with a multitude of ruby cabochons. A staff of healing grants an item bonus to the Hit Points you restore anytime you cast the {@spell heal|CRB} spell using your own spell slots or using charges from the staff.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

entries: The item bonus granted to {@spell heal|CRB} spells is +1.
The item bonus granted to {@spell heal|CRB} spells is +2.
The item bonus granted to {@spell heal|CRB} spells is +3.

items: {@bold 5th} {@spell breath of life|CRB}, {@spell heal|CRB}, {@spell remove disease|CRB}

entries: The item bonus granted to {@spell heal|CRB} spells is +4.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Illumination
entries: This simple iron staff is capped with a faceted, clear gem.

effect: The gem at the top of the staff glows as a torch, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 10 minutes.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Illusion
entries: This ornately designed metal staff shines with precious inlays of gold. When you {@action Cast a Spell|CRB} from the staff, the illusory image of something you desire flashes across its surface.
While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify illusion magic.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Necromancy
entries: This twisted and grim-looking staff is adorned with hideous skull and bone motifs. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify necromancy magic.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of Power
entries: This staff of magically hardened wood is topped with a silver sculpture depicting magical runic symbols. When used as a weapon, a staff of power is a +2 greater striking staff.

Voluntarily destroying a staff of power unleashes an incredible blast of energy. When wielding the staff, you can {@action Interact|CRB} to break it. This releases a 30-foot-burst magical explosion centered on the staff. This deals {@dice 2d8} force damage per charge remaining in the staff (DC 40 basic Reflex save)
You automatically critically fail your save. A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies instantly; this is a death effect.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

items: {@bold 7th} {@spell cone of cold|CRB}, {@spell fireball|CRB}, {@spell lightning bolt|CRB}

item.craft_requirements: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

item.name: Staff Of The Magi
entries: Sigils and runes of ancient and powerful magic cover the iron cladding on this long wooden staff. A staff of the magi is a +3 major striking staff, and when wielding it you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells.

Voluntarily destroying a staff of the magi unleashes a truly devastating wave of arcane energy that surges out, dissipating with distance. When wielding the staff, you can break it using an {@action Interact|CRB} action. This releases a 30-foot‑burst magical explosion centered on the staff. This deals {@dice 2d10} force damage per charge remaining in the staff (DC 40 basic Reflex save), You automatically critically fail your save. The explosion continues to echo beyond the initial blast zone, dealing half as much damage to creatures beyond 30 feet but within a 60-foot burst. A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies instantly; this is a death effect.

effect: You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

items: {@bold Cantrip} {@spell detect magic|CRB}, light, {@spell mage hand|CRB}, telekinetic projectile
{@bold 2nd} {@spell enlarge|CRB}, {@spell glitterdust|CRB}, {@spell invisibility|CRB}, {@spell knock|CRB}, {@spell telekinetic maneuver|CRB}, {@spell web|CRB}
{@bold 4th} {@spell invisibility|CRB}, {@spell enlarge|CRB}, {@spell fireball|CRB}, {@spell wall of fire|CRB}, {@spell web|CRB}
